verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the man who has not walked in the counsel of the ungodly,
verses.secondHalf: nor stood in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the seat of the scornful;

verses.firstHalf: But his delight is in the law of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and on his law will he meditate day and night.

verses.firstHalf: And he shall be like a tree planted by the waterside,
verses.secondHalf: that will bring forth his fruit in due season.

verses.firstHalf: His leaf also shall not wither;
verses.secondHalf: and look, whatever he does, it shall prosper.

verses.firstHalf: As for the ungodly, it is not so with them;
verses.secondHalf: but they are like the chaff, which the wind scatters away from the face of the earth.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore the ungodly shall not be able to stand in the judgment,
verses.secondHalf: neither the sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD knows the way of the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.firstHalf: Why do the nations so furiously rage together?
verses.secondHalf: And why do the peoples devise a vain thing?

verses.firstHalf: The kings of the earth stand up, and the rulers take counsel together,
verses.secondHalf: against the LORD and against his Anointed:

verses.firstHalf: “Let us break their bonds asunder
verses.secondHalf: and cast away their cords from us.”

verses.firstHalf: He who dwells in heaven shall laugh them to scorn;
verses.secondHalf: the Lord shall hold them in derision.

verses.firstHalf: Then shall he speak to them in his wrath
verses.secondHalf: and terrify them in his great anger:

verses.firstHalf: “I myself have set my King
verses.secondHalf: upon my holy hill of Zion.”

verses.firstHalf: I will proclaim the decree of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: he said to me, “You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.

verses.firstHalf: Ask of me, and I shall give you the nations for your inheritance
verses.secondHalf: and the ends of the earth for your possession.

verses.firstHalf: You shall bruise them with a rod of iron
verses.secondHalf: and break them in pieces like a potter’s vessel.”

verses.firstHalf: Be wise now, O you kings;
verses.secondHalf: be warned, you judges of the earth.

verses.firstHalf: Serve the LORD in fear,
verses.secondHalf: and rejoice with trembling.

verses.firstHalf: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish in the way; for his wrath is quickly kindled.
verses.secondHalf: Blessed are all those who put their trust in him.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, how they are increased who trouble me;
verses.secondHalf: many are those who rise against me.

verses.firstHalf: Many there are who say of my soul,
verses.secondHalf: “There is no help for him in his God.”

verses.firstHalf: But you, O LORD, are my defender;
verses.secondHalf: you are my glory, and the one who lifts up my head.

verses.firstHalf: I called upon the LORD with my voice,
verses.secondHalf: and he heard me from his holy hill.

verses.firstHalf: I lay down and slept, and rose up again,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD sustained me.

verses.firstHalf: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of the people
verses.secondHalf: who have set themselves against me round about.

verses.firstHalf: Rise up, O LORD, and help me, O my God;
verses.secondHalf: for you smite all my enemies on the cheek-bone; you have broken the teeth of the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: Salvation belongs to the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: may your blessing be upon your people.

verses.firstHalf: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness;
verses.secondHalf: you set me free when I was in trouble; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

verses.firstHalf: O you children of men, how long will you blaspheme my honor,
verses.secondHalf: and have such pleasure in vanity, and seek after falsehood?

verses.firstHalf: Know this also, that the LORD has chosen for himself the one that is godly;
verses.secondHalf: when I call upon the LORD, he will hear me.

verses.firstHalf: Stand in awe, and sin not;
verses.secondHalf: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still.

verses.firstHalf: Offer the sacrifice of righteousness
verses.secondHalf: and put your trust in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: There are many that say, “Who will show us any good?”
verses.secondHalf: LORD, lift up the light of your countenance upon us.

verses.firstHalf: You have put gladness in my heart,
verses.secondHalf: more than when others’ grain and wine and oil increased.

verses.firstHalf: I will lay me down in peace, and take my rest;
verses.secondHalf: for you, LORD, only, make me dwell in safety.

verses.firstHalf: Give ear to my words, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: consider my meditation.

verses.firstHalf: O hearken unto the voice of my calling, my King and my God,
verses.secondHalf: for unto you will I make my prayer.

verses.firstHalf: My voice shall you hear in the morning, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: early in the morning will I direct my prayer unto you, and will look up.

verses.firstHalf: For you are not a god who has pleasure in wickedness,
verses.secondHalf: neither shall any evil dwell with you.

verses.firstHalf: The boastful shall not stand in your sight,
verses.secondHalf: for you hate all those who work iniquity.

verses.firstHalf: You shall destroy those who speak lies;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD will abhor the bloodthirsty and the deceitful.

verses.firstHalf: But as for me, through the multitude of your mercies I will come into your house,
verses.secondHalf: and in reverence will I bow myself toward your holy temple.

verses.firstHalf: Lead me, O LORD, in your righteousness, because of my enemies;
verses.secondHalf: make your way straight before my face.

verses.firstHalf: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth;
verses.secondHalf: their heart is eaten up with wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Their throat is an open sepulcher;
verses.secondHalf: they flatter with their tongue.

verses.firstHalf: Declare them guilty, O God; let them fall because of their own devices;
verses.secondHalf: because of the multitude of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.

verses.firstHalf: But let all those who put their trust in you rejoice;
verses.secondHalf: let them ever give thanks because you defend them; those who love your Name shall be joyful in you.

verses.firstHalf: For you, LORD, will give your blessing unto the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: and with your favorable kindness you will defend him as with a shield.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, rebuke me not in your indignation,
verses.secondHalf: neither chasten me in your displeasure.

verses.firstHalf: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am weak;
verses.secondHalf: O LORD, heal me, for my bones are racked.

verses.firstHalf: My soul also is greatly troubled;
verses.secondHalf: but, LORD, how long will you punish me?

verses.firstHalf: Turn, O LORD, and deliver my soul;
verses.secondHalf: O save me for your mercy’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: For in death no one remembers you,
verses.secondHalf: and who will give you thanks in the grave?

verses.firstHalf: I am weary with my groaning;
verses.secondHalf: every night I flood my bed and drench my couch with my tears.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes have become dim because of trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and worn away because of all my enemies.

verses.firstHalf: Away from me, all you who work wickedness,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD has heard the voice of my weeping.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has heard my petition;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD will receive my prayer.

verses.firstHalf: All my enemies shall be confounded and greatly vexed;
verses.secondHalf: they shall be turned back and put to shame suddenly.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD my God, in you have I put my trust;
verses.secondHalf: save me from all those who persecute me, and deliver me,

verses.firstHalf: Lest they devour me like a lion and tear me in pieces
verses.secondHalf: while there is none to help.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD my God, if I have done any such thing,
verses.secondHalf: if there be any wickedness in my hands,

verses.firstHalf: If I have repaid evil to him who has dealt with me as a friend,
verses.secondHalf: or plundered him who without any cause is my enemy,

verses.firstHalf: Then let my enemy pursue me and overtake me,
verses.secondHalf: let him trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust.

verses.firstHalf: Stand up, O LORD, in your wrath, and lift yourself up against the fury of my enemies;
verses.secondHalf: rise up for me in the judgment that you have commanded.

verses.firstHalf: Then shall the assembly of the peoples be gathered about you;
verses.secondHalf: lift yourself up again, O LORD, O judge of all the nations.

verses.firstHalf: Give sentence for me, O LORD, according to my righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and according to the innocence that is in me.

verses.firstHalf: O let the wickedness of the ungodly come to an end,
verses.secondHalf: but establish the just.

verses.firstHalf: For the righteous God
verses.secondHalf: tries the very hearts and minds.

verses.firstHalf: God is my shield and my defense;
verses.secondHalf: he preserves those who are true of heart.

verses.firstHalf: God is a righteous judge, strong and patient;
verses.secondHalf: and God is provoked every day.

verses.firstHalf: If a man will not repent, God will whet his sword;
verses.secondHalf: he will bend his bow, and make it ready.

verses.firstHalf: He has prepared for him the instruments of death;
verses.secondHalf: he makes his arrows shafts of fire.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, the ungodly is in labor with mischief;
verses.secondHalf: he has conceived wickedness and brought forth lies.

verses.firstHalf: He has made a pit and dug it out,
verses.secondHalf: but will himself fall into the trap that he made for others.

verses.firstHalf: For his malice shall come upon his own head,
verses.secondHalf: and his wickedness shall fall on his own scalp.

verses.firstHalf: I will give thanks unto the LORD, according to his righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD our Governor, how excellent is your Name in all the world;
verses.secondHalf: you have set your glory above the heavens!

verses.firstHalf: Out of the mouth of babes and infants you have ordained strength, because of your enemies,
verses.secondHalf: that you might still the enemy and the avenger.

verses.firstHalf: When I consider your heavens, even the works of your fingers,
verses.secondHalf: the moon and the stars, which you have ordained,

verses.firstHalf: What is man, that you are mindful of him,
verses.secondHalf: the son of man, that you visit him?

verses.firstHalf: You made him little lower than the angels,
verses.secondHalf: to crown him with glory and honor.

verses.firstHalf: You made him to have dominion over the works of your hands,
verses.secondHalf: and you have put all things in subjection under his feet:

verses.firstHalf: All sheep and oxen,
verses.secondHalf: even the beasts of the field,

verses.firstHalf: The birds of the air, and the fish of the sea,
verses.secondHalf: and whatsoever walks through the paths of the seas.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD our Governor,
verses.secondHalf: how excellent is your Name in all the world!

verses.firstHalf: I will give thanks unto you, O LORD, with my whole heart;
verses.secondHalf: I will speak of all your marvelous works.

verses.firstHalf: I will be glad and rejoice in you;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, my songs will I sing of your Name, O Most High.

verses.firstHalf: When my enemies are driven back,
verses.secondHalf: they shall fall and perish at your presence;

verses.firstHalf: For you have maintained my right and my cause;
verses.secondHalf: you sit on your throne judging right.

verses.firstHalf: You have rebuked the nations and destroyed the ungodly;
verses.secondHalf: you have blotted out their name for ever and ever.

verses.firstHalf: As for the enemy, their destruction has come; they are in perpetual ruin;
verses.secondHalf: like the cities which you have destroyed, their memory has perished with them.

verses.firstHalf: But the LORD sits enthroned for ever;
verses.secondHalf: he has prepared his seat for judgment.

verses.firstHalf: For he shall judge the world in righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and minister true judgment to the peoples.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD will be a defense for the oppressed,
verses.secondHalf: even a refuge in the time of trouble;

verses.firstHalf: And those who know your Name will put their trust in you,
verses.secondHalf: for you, LORD, have never failed those who seek you.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD who dwells in Zion;
verses.secondHalf: tell the peoples what things he has done.

verses.firstHalf: For when he takes vengeance for blood, he remembers them,
verses.secondHalf: and forgets not the cry of the poor.

verses.firstHalf: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider the trouble I suffer from those who hate me,
verses.secondHalf: O you who lift me up from the gates of death,

verses.firstHalf: That I may tell of all your praises within the gates of the daughter of Zion;
verses.secondHalf: I will rejoice in your salvation.

verses.firstHalf: The nations have sunk down in the pit that they made;
verses.secondHalf: in the same net which they hid secretly is their foot caught.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is known to execute judgment;
verses.secondHalf: the ungodly are trapped in the works of their own hands.

verses.firstHalf: The wicked shall return to the grave,
verses.secondHalf: even all the peoples that forget God.

verses.firstHalf: For the poor shall not always be forgotten;
verses.secondHalf: the patient hope of the meek shall not perish for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Rise up, O LORD, and let them not have the upper hand;
verses.secondHalf: let the nations be judged in your sight.

verses.firstHalf: Put them in fear, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: that the nations may know themselves to be merely human.

verses.firstHalf: Why do you stand so far off, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and hide your face in the time of need and trouble?

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly in his pride persecutes the poor;
verses.secondHalf: let him be taken in the crafty schemes that he has imagined.

verses.firstHalf: For the ungodly has boasted of his own heart’s desire;
verses.secondHalf: the covetous holds the LORD in contempt and blasphemes his Name.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly is so proud that he cares not for God;
verses.secondHalf: neither is God in any of his thoughts.

verses.firstHalf: His ways are always grievous;
verses.secondHalf: your judgments are far above, out of his sight, and therefore he defies all his enemies.

verses.firstHalf: For he has said in his heart, “I shall never be cast down;
verses.secondHalf: no harm shall happen to me.”

verses.firstHalf: His mouth is full of cursing, deceit, and fraud;
verses.secondHalf: under his tongue are ungodliness and vanity.

verses.firstHalf: He sits lurking in the thievish corners of the streets, and in his hiding places he murders the innocent;
verses.secondHalf: his eyes are set against the poor.

verses.firstHalf: For he lies waiting secretly, even as a lion lurks in his den,
verses.secondHalf: that he may ravish the poor.

verses.firstHalf: He ravishes the poor
verses.secondHalf: when he gets him into his net.

verses.firstHalf: The innocent is crushed and humbled before him,
verses.secondHalf: and the weak cannot stand against his might.

verses.firstHalf: He has said in his heart, “God has forgotten;
verses.secondHalf: he hides away his face, and he will never see it.”

verses.firstHalf: Arise, O LORD God, and lift up your hand;
verses.secondHalf: forget not the poor.

verses.firstHalf: Why should the wicked blaspheme God,
verses.secondHalf: while he says in his heart, “You, O God, do not care”?

verses.firstHalf: Surely you have seen it, for you behold ungodliness and wrong,
verses.secondHalf: that you may take the matter into your hand.

verses.firstHalf: The poor commits himself unto you,
verses.secondHalf: for you are the helper of the fatherless.

verses.firstHalf: Break the power of the ungodly and malicious;
verses.secondHalf: search out his ungodliness until you have brought it all to light.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is King for ever and ever,
verses.secondHalf: and the nations have perished out of the land.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, you have heard the desire of the poor;
verses.secondHalf: you prepare their heart, and your ear hearkens to it,

verses.firstHalf: To help the fatherless and poor with justice,
verses.secondHalf: that the one who is of the earth may terrify no more.

verses.firstHalf: To help the fatherless and poor with justice,
verses.secondHalf: that the one who is of the earth may terrify no more.

verses.firstHalf: In the LORD I put my trust;
verses.secondHalf: how then can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird unto the hill;

verses.firstHalf: For behold, the ungodly bend their bow, and make ready their arrow upon the string,
verses.secondHalf: that they may secretly shoot at those who are true of heart.

verses.firstHalf: For the foundations will be cast down,
verses.secondHalf: and what can the righteous do?”

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is in his holy temple;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD’s throne is in heaven.

verses.firstHalf: His eyes consider the poor,
verses.secondHalf: and his eyelids try the children of men.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD tests the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: but the ungodly, and those who delight in wickedness, his soul abhors.

verses.firstHalf: Upon the ungodly he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, storm and tempest;
verses.secondHalf: this shall be their portion to drink.

verses.firstHalf: For the righteous LORD loves righteousness;
verses.secondHalf: the upright shall behold his face.

verses.firstHalf: Help me, O LORD, for there is no godly one left;
verses.secondHalf: for the faithful have vanished from among the children of men.

verses.firstHalf: They speak falsely, every one with his neighbor;
verses.secondHalf: they flatter with their lips and deceive with a double heart.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall root out all deceitful lips
verses.secondHalf: and the tongues that speak proud things,

verses.firstHalf: Which have said, “With our tongue will we prevail;
verses.secondHalf: our lips are our own; who is lord over us?”

verses.firstHalf: “Now because of the trouble of the needy
verses.secondHalf: and because of the deep sighing of the poor,

verses.firstHalf: I will rise up,” says the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: “and will give help to every one who longs for it.”

verses.firstHalf: The words of the LORD are pure words, even as silver that is tried in the furnace,
verses.secondHalf: and as gold that is purified seven times in the fire.

verses.firstHalf: Preserve us, O Lord, and save us
verses.secondHalf: from this perverse and evil generation.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly walk on every side
verses.secondHalf: when wickedness is exalted among the children of men.

verses.firstHalf: How long will you utterly forget me, O LORD?
verses.secondHalf: How long will you hide your face from me?

verses.firstHalf: How long shall I seek counsel in my soul and be so vexed in my heart?
verses.secondHalf: How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

verses.firstHalf: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God;
verses.secondHalf: give light to my eyes, that I sleep not in death,

verses.firstHalf: Lest my enemy say, “I have prevailed against him”;
verses.secondHalf: for if I am cast down, those who trouble me will rejoice.

verses.firstHalf: But my trust is in your mercy,
verses.secondHalf: and my heart is joyful in your salvation.

verses.firstHalf: I will sing of the LORD, because he has dealt so lovingly with me;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, I will praise the Name of the LORD Most High.

verses.firstHalf: The fool has said in his heart,
verses.secondHalf: “There is no God.”

verses.firstHalf: They are corrupt and have become abominable in their doings;
verses.secondHalf: there is none that does good, no, not one.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men,
verses.secondHalf: to see if there were any who would understand and seek after God.

verses.firstHalf: But they have all gone astray; they have altogether become abominable;
verses.secondHalf: there is none that does good, no, not one.

verses.firstHalf: Have they no knowledge, all those workers of evil,
verses.secondHalf: who eat up my people as bread, and call not upon the LORD?

verses.firstHalf: There were they brought into great fear, even where no fear was;
verses.secondHalf: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

verses.firstHalf: Though you have made a mockery of the counsel of the poor,
verses.secondHalf: yet they put their trust in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Who shall give salvation unto Israel out of Zion?
verses.secondHalf: When the LORD restores his captive people, then shall Jacob rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, who shall dwell in your tabernacle?
verses.secondHalf: Or who shall rest upon your holy hill?

verses.firstHalf: Whoever leads an uncorrupt life,
verses.secondHalf: and does that which is right, and speaks the truth from his heart.

verses.firstHalf: He has not spoken deceitfully with his tongue, nor done evil to his neighbor,
verses.secondHalf: and has not slandered his neighbor.

verses.firstHalf: In his eyes the wicked is rejected,
verses.secondHalf: and he makes much of those who fear the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: He swears to his neighbor and disappoints him not,
verses.secondHalf: though it were to his own hindrance.

verses.firstHalf: He has not given his money for usury,
verses.secondHalf: nor taken a bribe against the innocent.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever does these things
verses.secondHalf: shall never be overthrown.

verses.firstHalf: Preserve me, O God,
verses.secondHalf: for in you have I put my trust.

verses.firstHalf: O my soul, you have said unto the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: “You are my Lord; I have no good apart from you.”

verses.firstHalf: All my delight is upon the saints who are on the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and upon those who excel in virtue.

verses.firstHalf: But those who run after another god
verses.secondHalf: shall have great trouble.

verses.firstHalf: Their drink offerings of blood I will not offer,
verses.secondHalf: neither make mention of their names with my lips.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD himself is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup;
verses.secondHalf: you shall maintain my lot.

verses.firstHalf: The boundaries have fallen for me in pleasant places;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, I have a goodly heritage.

verses.firstHalf: I will thank the LORD for giving me counsel;
verses.secondHalf: my heart also chastens me in the night season.

verses.firstHalf: I have set the LORD always before me;
verses.secondHalf: he is at my right hand; therefore I shall not fall.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore my heart is glad and my soul rejoices.
verses.secondHalf: My flesh also shall rest in hope.

verses.firstHalf: For you shall not leave my soul in the grave,
verses.secondHalf: neither shall you allow your Holy One to see corruption.

verses.firstHalf: You shall show me the path of life; in your presence is the fullness of joy,
verses.secondHalf: and at your right hand there is pleasure for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: Hear what is right, O LORD; consider my complaint;
verses.secondHalf: hearken to my prayer, which does not come from lying lips.

verses.firstHalf: Let justice for me come forth from your presence,
verses.secondHalf: and let your eyes look upon that which is right.

verses.firstHalf: You have tested and visited my heart in the night season.
verses.secondHalf: If you try me you shall find no wickedness in me; my mouth shall not offend.

verses.firstHalf: As for the works of others,
verses.secondHalf: because of the words of your lips, I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.

verses.firstHalf: Hold my steps firmly in your paths,
verses.secondHalf: that my footsteps may not slip.

verses.firstHalf: I have called upon you, O God, for you will hear me;
verses.secondHalf: incline your ear to me and hearken to my words.

verses.firstHalf: Show your marvelous loving-kindness, you that are the Savior of those who put their trust in you
verses.secondHalf: from the ones who resist your right hand.

verses.firstHalf: Keep me as the apple of your eye;
verses.secondHalf: hide me under the shadow of your wings,

verses.firstHalf: From the ungodly who assault me,
verses.secondHalf: even from my enemies who encompass me to take away my soul.

verses.firstHalf: They have closed their heart to pity,
verses.secondHalf: and their mouth speaks proud things.

verses.firstHalf: They lie waiting in my way on every side,
verses.secondHalf: watching how they may cast me down to the ground,

verses.firstHalf: Like a lion that is greedy for its prey,
verses.secondHalf: and like a young lion lurking in secret places.

verses.firstHalf: Rise up, O LORD, confront them and cast them down;
verses.secondHalf: deliver my soul from the ungodly by your sword and by your hand,

verses.firstHalf: From those, O LORD, from those whose portion in life is of the world,
verses.secondHalf: whose bellies you fill with your hidden treasure.

verses.firstHalf: They have children at their desire,
verses.secondHalf: and leave the rest of their abundance for their little ones.

verses.firstHalf: But as for me, I will behold your presence in righteousness;
verses.secondHalf: and when I awake and see your likeness, I shall be satisfied.

verses.firstHalf: I will love you, O LORD my strength;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD is my rock, my stronghold, and my deliverer,

verses.firstHalf: My Savior, my God, and my might in whom I will trust,
verses.secondHalf: my buckler, the horn of my salvation, and my refuge.

verses.firstHalf: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised;
verses.secondHalf: so shall I be safe from my enemies.

verses.firstHalf: The waves of death encompassed me;
verses.secondHalf: the floods that would swallow me up made me afraid.

verses.firstHalf: The cords of the grave surrounded me;
verses.secondHalf: the snares of death overtook me.

verses.firstHalf: In my trouble I called upon the LORD
verses.secondHalf: and cried unto my God for help.

verses.firstHalf: From his holy temple he heard my voice.
verses.secondHalf: My complaint came before him; it entered into his ears.

verses.firstHalf: The earth trembled and quaked;
verses.secondHalf: the very foundations of the hills shook and were removed, because he was angry.

verses.firstHalf: There went out smoke from his nostrils and a consuming fire out of his mouth;
verses.secondHalf: coals of fire issued from his presence.

verses.firstHalf: He parted the heavens also and came down,
verses.secondHalf: and it was dark under his feet.

verses.firstHalf: He rode upon the cherubim and flew;
verses.secondHalf: he came flying upon the wings of the wind.

verses.firstHalf: He made darkness his secret place;
verses.secondHalf: dark waters and thick clouds were his covering round about him.

verses.firstHalf: At the brightness of his presence his clouds broke forth:
verses.secondHalf: hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD also thundered out of heaven, and the Most High gave forth his voice:
verses.secondHalf: hailstones and coals of fire.

verses.firstHalf: He sent out his arrows and scattered them;
verses.secondHalf: he cast forth lightning and destroyed them.

verses.firstHalf: The springs of water were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered,
verses.secondHalf: at your rebuke, O LORD, at the blasting of the breath of your displeasure.

verses.firstHalf: He reached down from on high to grasp me,
verses.secondHalf: and he took me out of many waters.

verses.firstHalf: He delivered me from my strongest enemy, and from those who hated me,
verses.secondHalf: for they were too mighty for me.

verses.firstHalf: They confronted me in the day of my trouble,
verses.secondHalf: but the LORD upheld me.

verses.firstHalf: He brought me forth into a place of liberty;
verses.secondHalf: he delivered me, because I had found favor in his eyes.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteous dealing;
verses.secondHalf: according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me,

verses.firstHalf: Because I had kept the ways of the LORD
verses.secondHalf: and had not forsaken my God, as the wicked do.

verses.firstHalf: For I had an eye unto all his laws
verses.secondHalf: and did not cast out his commandments from me.

verses.firstHalf: I was also uncorrupt before him
verses.secondHalf: and kept myself from my own wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore the LORD rewarded me according to my righteous dealing,
verses.secondHalf: and according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

verses.firstHalf: With the faithful you show yourself faithful,
verses.secondHalf: and with the upright you show yourself upright.

verses.firstHalf: With the pure you show yourself pure,
verses.secondHalf: but with the crooked you show yourself shrewd.

verses.firstHalf: For you shall save the people who are in adversity,
verses.secondHalf: but shall bring down the high looks of the proud.

verses.firstHalf: You also shall light my lamp;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD my God shall turn my darkness into light.

verses.firstHalf: For with you I shall crush a host of men,
verses.secondHalf: and with the help of my God I can leap over a wall.

verses.firstHalf: The way of God is an undefiled way; the word of the LORD also is tried in the fire;
verses.secondHalf: he is the defender of all those who put their trust in him.

verses.firstHalf: For who is God, but the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: or who is a rock, except our God?

verses.firstHalf: It is God who girds me with strength for war
verses.secondHalf: and makes my way perfect.

verses.firstHalf: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer
verses.secondHalf: and sets me up on high.

verses.firstHalf: He teaches my hands to fight,
verses.secondHalf: and my arms shall bend even a bow of bronze.

verses.firstHalf: You have given me the shield of your salvation;
verses.secondHalf: your right hand also shall hold me up, and your loving correction shall make me great.

verses.firstHalf: You have made a broad path for my feet,
verses.secondHalf: and my footsteps shall not slip.

verses.firstHalf: I will follow my enemies and overtake them;
verses.secondHalf: I will not turn again until I have destroyed them.

verses.firstHalf: I will smite them, and they shall not be able to stand.
verses.secondHalf: They shall fall under my feet.

verses.firstHalf: You have girded me with strength for the battle;
verses.secondHalf: you shall throw down my enemies under me.

verses.firstHalf: You have made my enemies turn their backs upon me,
verses.secondHalf: and I shall destroy those who hate me.

verses.firstHalf: They shall cry, but there shall be none to help them;
verses.secondHalf: even unto the LORD shall they cry, but he shall not hear them.

verses.firstHalf: I will beat them as small as dust before the wind;
verses.secondHalf: I will tread them down as mire in the streets.

verses.firstHalf: You shall deliver me from the strivings of the peoples,
verses.secondHalf: and you shall make me the head of the nations.

verses.firstHalf: A people whom I have not known
verses.secondHalf: shall be in subjection under me.

verses.firstHalf: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me;
verses.secondHalf: and foreigners shall cringe before me.

verses.firstHalf: Foreigners shall lose heart,
verses.secondHalf: and, being afraid, shall come out of their strongholds.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD lives, and blessed be my rock,
verses.secondHalf: and praised be the God of my salvation,

verses.firstHalf: Even the God who sees that I am avenged
verses.secondHalf: and subdues the peoples under me.

verses.firstHalf: It is he who delivers me from my cruel enemies, and lifts me up above my adversaries;
verses.secondHalf: you shall rid me of the wicked.

verses.firstHalf: For this cause will I give thanks unto you, O LORD, among the nations,
verses.secondHalf: and sing praises unto your Name.

verses.firstHalf: Great prosperity he gives unto his King,
verses.secondHalf: and shows loving-kindness to David his Anointed, and unto his seed for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: The heavens declare the glory of God,
verses.secondHalf: and the firmament shows his handiwork.

verses.firstHalf: One day speaks to another,
verses.secondHalf: and one night gives knowledge to another.

verses.firstHalf: There is neither speech nor language,
verses.secondHalf: and their voices are not heard;

verses.firstHalf: But their sound has gone out into all lands,
verses.secondHalf: and their words to the ends of the world.

verses.firstHalf: In them he has set a tent for the sun,
verses.secondHalf: which comes forth as a bridegroom out of his chamber, and rejoices like a strong man to run his course.

verses.firstHalf: It goes forth from the uttermost part of the heavens, and runs about to the end of it again,
verses.secondHalf: and there is nothing hidden from its heat.

verses.firstHalf: The law of the LORD is perfect, reviving the soul;
verses.secondHalf: the testimony of the LORD is sure, and gives wisdom to the simple.

verses.firstHalf: The statutes of the LORD are right, and rejoice the heart;
verses.secondHalf: the commandment of the LORD is pure, and gives light to the eyes.

verses.firstHalf: The fear of the LORD is clean, and endures for ever;
verses.secondHalf: the judgments of the LORD are true, and righteous altogether.

verses.firstHalf: More to be desired are they than gold, even much fine gold;
verses.secondHalf: sweeter also than honey, than the drippings from the honeycomb.

verses.firstHalf: Moreover, by them is your servant taught,
verses.secondHalf: and in keeping them there is great reward.

verses.firstHalf: Who can tell how often he offends?
verses.secondHalf: O cleanse me from my secret faults.

verses.firstHalf: Keep your servant also from presumptuous sins, lest they get the dominion over me;
verses.secondHalf: so shall I be undefiled, and innocent of great offense.

verses.firstHalf: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be always acceptable in your sight,
verses.secondHalf: O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.

verses.firstHalf: May the LORD hear you in the day of trouble,
verses.secondHalf: the Name of the God of Jacob defend you;

verses.firstHalf: Send you help from the sanctuary,
verses.secondHalf: and strengthen you out of Zion;

verses.firstHalf: Remember all your offerings,
verses.secondHalf: and accept your burnt sacrifice;

verses.firstHalf: Grant you your heart’s desire,
verses.secondHalf: and accomplish all your plans.

verses.firstHalf: We will rejoice in your salvation, and triumph in the Name of the Lord our God;
verses.secondHalf: may the LORD grant all your petitions.

verses.firstHalf: Now I know that the LORD helps his Anointed, and will answer him from his holy heaven,
verses.secondHalf: even with the saving strength of his right hand.

verses.firstHalf: Some put their trust in chariots, and some in horses,
verses.secondHalf: but we put our trust in the Name of the LORD our God.

verses.firstHalf: They are brought down and fallen,
verses.secondHalf: but we will arise and stand upright.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, save the King,
verses.secondHalf: and hear us when we call upon you.

verses.firstHalf: The King shall rejoice in your strength, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: exceedingly glad shall he be of your salvation.

verses.firstHalf: You have given him his heart’s desire,
verses.secondHalf: and have not denied him the request of his lips.

verses.firstHalf: For you shall meet him with the blessings of goodness,
verses.secondHalf: and shall set a crown of pure gold upon his head.

verses.firstHalf: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him:
verses.secondHalf: length of days, for ever and ever.

verses.firstHalf: His honor is great because of your salvation;
verses.secondHalf: glory and majesty shall you lay upon him.

verses.firstHalf: For you shall give him everlasting felicity
verses.secondHalf: and make him glad with the joy of your countenance.

verses.firstHalf: For the King puts his trust in the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and because of the mercy of the Most High, he shall not be moved.

verses.firstHalf: All your enemies shall feel your hand;
verses.secondHalf: your right hand shall find those who hate you.

verses.firstHalf: You shall make them like a fiery oven in the time of your wrath;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD shall destroy them in his displeasure, and the fire shall consume them.

verses.firstHalf: Their offspring you shall root out of the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.firstHalf: For they intended evil against you,
verses.secondHalf: and imagined wicked schemes, which they are not able to perform.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore you shall put them to flight,
verses.secondHalf: and the strings of your bow you shall aim at their faces.

verses.firstHalf: Be exalted, O LORD, in your own strength;
verses.secondHalf: so we will sing and praise your power.

verses.firstHalf: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me,
verses.secondHalf: and are so far from my cry, and from the words of my complaint?

verses.firstHalf: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but you do not hear;
verses.secondHalf: in the night season also, but I find no rest.

verses.firstHalf: But you remain holy,
verses.secondHalf: enthroned upon the praises of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: Our fathers hoped in you;
verses.secondHalf: they trusted in you, and you delivered them.

verses.firstHalf: They called upon you, and were delivered;
verses.secondHalf: they put their trust in you, and were not confounded.

verses.firstHalf: But as for me, I am a worm, and no man,
verses.secondHalf: scorned by all, and the outcast of the people.

verses.firstHalf: All those who see me laugh me to scorn;
verses.secondHalf: they curl their lips, and shake their heads, saying,

verses.firstHalf: “He trusted in God, that he would deliver him;
verses.secondHalf: let him deliver him, if he will have him.”

verses.firstHalf: But you are he that took me out of my mother’s womb;
verses.secondHalf: you were my hope, when I was yet upon my mother’s breasts.

verses.firstHalf: I have been cast upon you ever since I was born;
verses.secondHalf: you are my God, even from my mother’s womb.

verses.firstHalf: O go not far from me, for trouble is near at hand,
verses.secondHalf: and there is none to help me.

verses.firstHalf: Many oxen have come around me;
verses.secondHalf: fat bulls of Bashan close me in on every side.

verses.firstHalf: They gape at me with their mouths,
verses.secondHalf: like a ravening and a roaring lion.

verses.firstHalf: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint;
verses.secondHalf: my heart also in the midst of my body is like melting wax.

verses.firstHalf: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, and my tongue cleaves to my gums,
verses.secondHalf: and you bring me into the dust of death.

verses.firstHalf: For many dogs have come about me,
verses.secondHalf: and the council of the wicked lays siege against me.

verses.firstHalf: They pierced my hands and my feet; I can count all my bones;
verses.secondHalf: they stand staring and looking upon me.

verses.firstHalf: They part my garments among them,
verses.secondHalf: and casts lots for my clothing.

verses.firstHalf: But be not far from me, O LORD.
verses.secondHalf: You are my succor; hasten to help me.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver my soul from the sword,
verses.secondHalf: my life from the power of the dog.

verses.firstHalf: Save me from the lion’s mouth,
verses.secondHalf: and my soul in misery from among the horns of wild oxen.

verses.firstHalf: I will declare your Name to my brethren;
verses.secondHalf: in the midst of the congregation I will praise you.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD, you that fear him;
verses.secondHalf: magnify him, all you seed of Jacob, and fear him, all you seed of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: For he has not despised nor abhorred the low estate of the poor;
verses.secondHalf: he has not hidden his face from him, but when he called unto him, he heard him.

verses.firstHalf: My praise is of you in the great congregation;
verses.secondHalf: my vows will I perform in the sight of those who fear him.

verses.firstHalf: The poor shall eat and be satisfied;
verses.secondHalf: those who seek after the LORD shall praise him; may your hearts live for ever.

verses.firstHalf: All the ends of the world shall remember, and be turned unto the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and all the families of the nations shall worship before him.

verses.firstHalf: For the kingdom is the LORD’s,
verses.secondHalf: and he is the Governor among the peoples.

verses.firstHalf: All those who sleep in the earth, how shall they worship him?
verses.secondHalf: All those who go down into the dust, how shall they kneel before him?

verses.firstHalf: But my life shall be preserved in his sight, and my children shall worship him;
verses.secondHalf: they shall tell of the Lord to the generations to come;

verses.firstHalf: And to a people yet unborn shall they declare his righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: that he has brought it to pass.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is my shepherd;
verses.secondHalf: therefore I can lack nothing.

verses.firstHalf: He shall feed me in green pastures
verses.secondHalf: and lead me forth beside the waters of comfort.

verses.firstHalf: He shall refresh my soul
verses.secondHalf: and bring me forth in the paths of righteousness for his Name’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil,
verses.secondHalf: for you are with me; your rod and your staff comfort me.

verses.firstHalf: You shall prepare a table before me, in the presence of those who trouble me;
verses.secondHalf: you have anointed my head with oil, and my cup shall be full.

verses.firstHalf: Surely your goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life,
verses.secondHalf: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.

verses.firstHalf: The earth is the LORD’s and all that is in it,
verses.secondHalf: the compass of the world and those who dwell therein.

verses.firstHalf: For he has founded it upon the seas
verses.secondHalf: and established it upon the rivers of the deep.

verses.firstHalf: Who shall ascend the hill of the LORD?
verses.secondHalf: Or who shall stand in his holy place?

verses.firstHalf: He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
verses.secondHalf: and who has not set his mind upon vanity, nor sworn to deceive his neighbor.

verses.firstHalf: He shall receive blessing from the LORD
verses.secondHalf: and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

verses.firstHalf: This is the generation of those who seek him,
verses.secondHalf: even of those who seek your face, O God of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
verses.secondHalf: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.firstHalf: “Who is the King of glory?”
verses.secondHalf: “It is the LORD, strong and mighty, even the LORD, mighty in battle.”

verses.firstHalf: Lift up your heads, O you gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors;
verses.secondHalf: and the King of glory shall come in.

verses.firstHalf: “Who is the King of glory?”
verses.secondHalf: “The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory.”

verses.firstHalf: Unto you, O LORD, will I lift up my soul; my God, I have put my trust in you;
verses.secondHalf: O let me not be ashamed, neither let my enemies triumph over me.

verses.firstHalf: For all those who hope in you shall not be ashamed,
verses.secondHalf: but those who deal untruly shall be put to confusion.

verses.firstHalf: Show me your ways, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and teach me your paths.

verses.firstHalf: Lead me forth in your truth and teach me,
verses.secondHalf: for you are the God of my salvation; in you has been my hope all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: Call to remembrance, O LORD, your tender mercies,
verses.secondHalf: and your loving-kindnesses, which have been from of old.

verses.firstHalf: O remember not the sins and offenses of my youth,
verses.secondHalf: but according to your mercy think on me, O LORD, in your goodness.

verses.firstHalf: Gracious and righteous is the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

verses.firstHalf: Those who are meek shall he guide in judgment,
verses.secondHalf: and those who are gentle shall he teach his way.

verses.firstHalf: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth
verses.secondHalf: to those who keep his covenant and his testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: For your Name’s sake, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: forgive my sin, for it is great.

verses.firstHalf: Who is the one who fears the LORD?
verses.secondHalf: He shall teach him in the way that he shall choose.

verses.firstHalf: He shall dwell at ease,
verses.secondHalf: and his seed shall inherit the land.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD reveals his secret counsel to those who fear him,
verses.secondHalf: and he will show them his covenant.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes are ever looking to the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

verses.firstHalf: Turn to me, and have mercy on me,
verses.secondHalf: for I am desolate and in misery.

verses.firstHalf: The sorrows of my heart are enlarged;
verses.secondHalf: O bring me out of my troubles.

verses.firstHalf: Look upon my adversity and misery
verses.secondHalf: and forgive me all my sin.

verses.firstHalf: Consider my enemies, how many they are,
verses.secondHalf: and how they bear a tyrannous hate against me.

verses.firstHalf: O keep my soul and deliver me;
verses.secondHalf: let me not be ashamed, for I have put my trust in you.

verses.firstHalf: Let integrity and righteous dealing preserve me,
verses.secondHalf: for my hope has been in you.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver Israel, O God,
verses.secondHalf: out of all his troubles.

verses.firstHalf: Be my judge, O LORD, for I have walked innocently;
verses.secondHalf: my trust has been in the LORD; therefore I shall not fall.

verses.firstHalf: Test me, O LORD, and prove me;
verses.secondHalf: examine my heart and my mind.

verses.firstHalf: For your loving-kindness is ever before my eyes,
verses.secondHalf: and I will walk in your truth.

verses.firstHalf: I have not dwelt with evildoers,
verses.secondHalf: neither will I have fellowship with the deceitful.

verses.firstHalf: I have hated the company of the wicked,
verses.secondHalf: and will not sit among the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: I will wash my hands in innocence, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and so will I go to your altar,

verses.firstHalf: That I may lift up the voice of thanksgiving
verses.secondHalf: and tell of all your wondrous works.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, I have loved the habitation of your house
verses.secondHalf: and the place where your honor dwells.

verses.firstHalf: O take not away my soul with the sinners,
verses.secondHalf: nor my life with the bloodthirsty,

verses.firstHalf: Whose hands are full of wickedness,
verses.secondHalf: and their right hand full of bribes.

verses.firstHalf: But as for me, I will walk innocently;
verses.secondHalf: O deliver me, and be merciful unto me.

verses.firstHalf: My foot stands firm;
verses.secondHalf: I will praise the LORD in the congregations.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom then shall I fear?
verses.secondHalf: The LORD is the strength of my life; of whom then shall I be afraid?

verses.firstHalf: When the wicked, even my enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh,
verses.secondHalf: they stumbled and fell.

verses.firstHalf: Though a host were encamped against me, yet my heart would not be afraid,
verses.secondHalf: and though war rose up against me, yet would I put my trust in him.

verses.firstHalf: One thing have I desired of the LORD; one thing I seek:
verses.secondHalf: that I may dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life,

verses.firstHalf: To behold the fair beauty of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and to seek him in his temple.

verses.firstHalf: For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his tabernacle;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, in the secret place of his dwelling he shall hide me, and set me high upon a rock of stone.

verses.firstHalf: And now he shall lift up my head
verses.secondHalf: above my enemies round about me.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore I will offer in his dwelling an oblation with great gladness;
verses.secondHalf: I will sing and speak praises unto the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Hearken to my voice, O LORD, when I cry unto you;
verses.secondHalf: have mercy upon me and hear me.

verses.firstHalf: You speak to my heart and say, “Seek my face.”
verses.secondHalf: Your face, O LORD, will I seek.

verses.firstHalf: O hide not your face from me,
verses.secondHalf: nor cast your servant away in displeasure.

verses.firstHalf: You have been my helper;
verses.secondHalf: leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.

verses.firstHalf: When my father and my mother forsake me,
verses.secondHalf: the LORD takes me in.

verses.firstHalf: Teach me your way, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and lead me in the right way, because of my enemies.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver me not over to the will of my adversaries,
verses.secondHalf: for there are false witnesses who have risen up against me, and those who speak wrong.

verses.firstHalf: I would utterly have fainted,
verses.secondHalf: had I not believed that I would see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.

verses.firstHalf: O wait for the LORD; be strong, and he shall comfort your heart.
verses.secondHalf: O put your trust in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Unto you will I cry, O LORD my rock; do not be deaf to my prayer;
verses.secondHalf: lest, if you do not answer, I become like those who go down into the pit.

verses.firstHalf: Hear the voice of my humble petitions when I cry unto you,
verses.secondHalf: when I hold up my hands toward the sanctuary of your holy temple.

verses.firstHalf: O cast me not away, neither destroy me with the ungodly and evildoers,
verses.secondHalf: who speak as friends to their neighbors, but imagine evil in their hearts.

verses.firstHalf: Reward them according to their deeds
verses.secondHalf: and according to the wickedness of their own inventions.

verses.firstHalf: Recompense them according to the work of their hands;
verses.secondHalf: pay them what they have deserved.

verses.firstHalf: For they regard not in their mind the works of the LORD, nor the operation of his hands;
verses.secondHalf: therefore he shall break them down and not build them up.

verses.firstHalf: Praised be the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for he has heard the voice of my humble petitions.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart has trusted in him, and I am helped;
verses.secondHalf: therefore my heart dances for joy, and in my song will I praise him.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is my strength,
verses.secondHalf: and he is the sure defense of his Anointed.

verses.firstHalf: O save your people, and give your blessing to your inheritance;
verses.secondHalf: feed them, and lift them up for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Ascribe unto the LORD, O you mighty,
verses.secondHalf: ascribe unto the LORD worship and strength.

verses.firstHalf: Give the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.secondHalf: worship the LORD with holy worship.

verses.firstHalf: It is the LORD that commands the waters;
verses.secondHalf: it is the glorious God that makes the thunder.

verses.firstHalf: It is the LORD that rules the sea; the voice of the LORD is mighty in its working;
verses.secondHalf: the voice of the LORD is a glorious voice.

verses.firstHalf: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedar trees;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, the LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon.

verses.firstHalf: He makes them also to skip like a calf,
verses.secondHalf: Lebanon also, and Sirion, like a young ox.

verses.firstHalf: The voice of the LORD divides the flames of fire; the voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, the LORD shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

verses.firstHalf: The voice of the LORD makes the deer to bring forth young, and strips the forests bare;
verses.secondHalf: in his temple all cry, “Glory.”

verses.firstHalf: The LORD sits above the floodwaters,
verses.secondHalf: and the LORD remains King for ever.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall give strength to his people;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD shall give his people the blessing of peace.

verses.firstHalf: I will magnify you, O LORD, for you have lifted me up,
verses.secondHalf: and have not let my foes triumph over me.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD my God, I cried unto you,
verses.secondHalf: and you have made me whole.

verses.firstHalf: You, LORD, have brought my soul out of the Grave;
verses.secondHalf: you have saved my life from among those who go down to the Pit.

verses.firstHalf: Sing praises unto the LORD, O you saints of his,
verses.secondHalf: and give thanks unto him for the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.firstHalf: For his wrath endures but the twinkling of an eye, his pleasure for a lifetime;
verses.secondHalf: heaviness may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

verses.firstHalf: In my prosperity I said, “I shall never be moved;
verses.secondHalf: you, LORD, of your goodness, have made my hill so strong.”

verses.firstHalf: You turned your face from me,
verses.secondHalf: and I was distressed.

verses.firstHalf: Then I cried unto you, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and came to my Lord most humbly.

verses.firstHalf: What profit is there in my bloodshed,
verses.secondHalf: if I go down into the Pit?

verses.firstHalf: Shall the dust give thanks unto you?
verses.secondHalf: Or shall it declare your faithfulness?

verses.firstHalf: Hear, O LORD, and have mercy upon me.
verses.secondHalf: O LORD, be my helper.

verses.firstHalf: You have turned my lamentation into dancing;
verses.secondHalf: you have put off my sackcloth and girded me with gladness.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore shall my heart sing of your praise without ceasing.
verses.secondHalf: O LORD my God, I will give thanks unto you for ever.

verses.firstHalf: In you, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.secondHalf: let me never be put to confusion; deliver me in your righteousness.

verses.firstHalf: Bow down your ear to me,
verses.secondHalf: make haste to deliver me,

verses.firstHalf: And be my strong rock and house of defense,
verses.secondHalf: that you may save me.

verses.firstHalf: For you are my strong rock and my castle;
verses.secondHalf: be also my guide, and lead me for your Name’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: Draw me out of the net that they have laid secretly for me,
verses.secondHalf: for you are my strength.

verses.firstHalf: Into your hands I commend my spirit,
verses.secondHalf: for you have redeemed me, O LORD, O God of truth.

verses.firstHalf: I have hated those who hold to worthless vanities,
verses.secondHalf: and my trust has been in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: I will be glad and rejoice in your mercy,
verses.secondHalf: for you have considered my trouble, and have known my soul in adversities.

verses.firstHalf: You have not shut me up in the hand of the enemy,
verses.secondHalf: but have set my feet where they may walk at liberty.

verses.firstHalf: Have mercy upon me, O LORD, for I am in trouble;
verses.secondHalf: my eye is consumed with heaviness, and also my soul and my body.

verses.firstHalf: For my life has grown old with heaviness,
verses.secondHalf: and my years with mourning.

verses.firstHalf: My strength fails me because of my iniquity,
verses.secondHalf: and my bones are consumed.

verses.firstHalf: I have become a reproof among all my enemies, but especially among my neighbors;
verses.secondHalf: my acquaintances are afraid of me, and those who see me in the street shrink from me.

verses.firstHalf: I am utterly forgotten, as a dead man, out of mind;
verses.secondHalf: I have become like a broken vessel.

verses.firstHalf: For I have heard the whispering of the multitude, and fear is on every side,
verses.secondHalf: while they conspire together against me and take their counsel to take away my life.

verses.firstHalf: But my hope has been in you, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: I have said, “You are my God.”

verses.firstHalf: My time is in your hand;
verses.secondHalf: deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.

verses.firstHalf: Show your servant the light of your countenance,
verses.secondHalf: and save me for your mercy’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: Let me not be confounded, O LORD, for I have called upon you;
verses.secondHalf: let the ungodly be put to confusion, and be put to silence in the grave.

verses.firstHalf: Let the lying lips be put to silence,
verses.secondHalf: which cruelly, disdainfully, and despitefully speak against the righteous.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, how plentiful is your goodness, which you have laid up for those who fear you,
verses.secondHalf: and which you have prepared for those who put their trust in you, even before the children of men!

verses.firstHalf: You hide them in the secret place of your presence from those who conspire against them;
verses.secondHalf: you keep them in your refuge from the strife of tongues.

verses.firstHalf: Thanks be to the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for he has shown me marvellously great kindness in a strong city.

verses.firstHalf: But when I was afraid, I said in my haste,
verses.secondHalf: “I am cast out of the sight of your eyes.”

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, you heard the voice of my prayer
verses.secondHalf: when I cried unto you.

verses.firstHalf: O love the LORD, all you his saints,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD preserves those who are faithful, and plenteously repays the proud.

verses.firstHalf: Be strong, and he shall establish your heart,
verses.secondHalf: all you that put your trust in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the one whose unrighteousness is forgiven,
verses.secondHalf: and whose sin is covered.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the one to whom the LORD imputes no sin,
verses.secondHalf: and in whose spirit there is no guile.

verses.firstHalf: For while I held my tongue, my bones wasted away;
verses.secondHalf: I ceased not from groaning all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: For your hand was heavy upon me day and night,
verses.secondHalf: and I was dried up and withered, as in the drought of summer.

verses.firstHalf: Then I acknowledged my sin unto you,
verses.secondHalf: and I did not hide my iniquity.

verses.firstHalf: I said, “I will confess my sins unto the LORD”;
verses.secondHalf: and so you forgave the wickedness of my sin.

verses.firstHalf: For this reason shall all the godly make their prayers unto you at a time when you may be found;
verses.secondHalf: when the great floodwaters rise, they shall not reach them.

verses.firstHalf: You are my hiding-place; you shall preserve me from trouble;
verses.secondHalf: you shall encompass me with songs of deliverance.

verses.firstHalf: “I will instruct you and teach you in the way that you should go,
verses.secondHalf: and I will guide you with my eye.

verses.firstHalf: Do not be like the horse and mule, which have no understanding,
verses.secondHalf: whose mouths must be held with bit and bridle, or else they will not come near you.”

verses.firstHalf: Great troubles remain for the ungodly;
verses.secondHalf: but mercy embraces those who trust in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Be glad, O you righteous, and rejoice in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: and be joyful, all who are true of heart.

verses.firstHalf: Rejoice in the LORD, O you righteous;
verses.secondHalf: it is fitting for the just to be thankful.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD with the harp;
verses.secondHalf: sing praises unto him with the ten-stringed lute.

verses.firstHalf: Sing unto him a new song;
verses.secondHalf: make skillful melody and cry aloud with joy.

verses.firstHalf: For the word of the LORD is true,
verses.secondHalf: and all his works are faithful.

verses.firstHalf: He loves righteousness and true judgment;
verses.secondHalf: the earth is full of the goodness of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: By the word of the LORD were the heavens made,
verses.secondHalf: and all the hosts of them by the breath of his mouth.

verses.firstHalf: He gathers the waters of the sea together, as in a heap,
verses.secondHalf: and lays up the deep, as in a treasure house.

verses.firstHalf: Let all the earth fear the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: stand in awe of him, all you that dwell in the world.

verses.firstHalf: For he spoke, and it was done;
verses.secondHalf: he commanded and it stood fast.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD brings the counsel of the nations to naught;
verses.secondHalf: he makes the devices of the peoples to be of no effect, and casts out the counsels of princes.

verses.firstHalf: The counsel of the LORD shall endure for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and blessed are the people he has chosen for himself to be his inheritance.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD looks down from heaven and beholds all the children of men;
verses.secondHalf: from the habitation of his dwelling he considers all those who dwell on the earth.

verses.firstHalf: He fashions all the hearts of them
verses.secondHalf: and understands all their works.

verses.firstHalf: There is no king who can be saved by a mighty host;
verses.secondHalf: neither is any mighty man delivered by great strength.

verses.firstHalf: A horse is considered a vain hope to save a man;
verses.secondHalf: neither shall it deliver anyone by its great strength.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, the eye of the LORD is upon those who fear him,
verses.secondHalf: and upon those who put their trust in his mercy,

verses.firstHalf: To deliver their soul from death,
verses.secondHalf: and to feed them in the time of famine.

verses.firstHalf: Our soul has patiently waited for the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for he is our help and our shield.

verses.firstHalf: Our heart shall rejoice in him,
verses.secondHalf: because we have hoped in his holy Name.

verses.firstHalf: Let your merciful kindness, O LORD, be upon us,
verses.secondHalf: as we have put our trust in you.

verses.firstHalf: I will always give thanks unto the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: his praise shall ever be in my mouth.

verses.firstHalf: My soul shall make its boast in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: the humble shall hear this and be glad.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD with me,
verses.secondHalf: and let us magnify his Name together.

verses.firstHalf: I sought the LORD, and he heard me;
verses.secondHalf: he delivered me out of all my fears.

verses.firstHalf: They looked unto him, and were made glad,
verses.secondHalf: and their faces were not ashamed.

verses.firstHalf: Look, the poor man cries, and the LORD hears him,
verses.secondHalf: and saves him out of all his troubles.

verses.firstHalf: The angel of the LORD camps round about those who fear him,
verses.secondHalf: and delivers them in time of need.

verses.firstHalf: O taste and see how gracious the LORD is;
verses.secondHalf: blessed is the one who trusts in him.

verses.firstHalf: O fear the LORD, you that are his saints;
verses.secondHalf: for those who fear him lack nothing.

verses.firstHalf: The lions lack and suffer hunger,
verses.secondHalf: but those who seek the LORD shall lack nothing that is good.

verses.firstHalf: Come, children, and listen to me;
verses.secondHalf: I will teach you the fear of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Who among you desires to live,
verses.secondHalf: and longs to see good days?

verses.firstHalf: Keep your tongue from evil,
verses.secondHalf: and your lips from speaking lies.

verses.firstHalf: Turn from evil and do good;
verses.secondHalf: seek peace and pursue it.

verses.firstHalf: The eyes of the LORD are upon the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: and his ears are open to their prayers.

verses.firstHalf: The countenance of the LORD is against those who do evil,
verses.secondHalf: to root out the remembrance of them from the earth.

verses.firstHalf: The righteous cry, and the LORD hears them
verses.secondHalf: and delivers them out of all their troubles.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is near to those who are brokenhearted
verses.secondHalf: and will save those who are crushed in spirit.

verses.firstHalf: Great are the troubles of the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: but the LORD delivers him out of them all.

verses.firstHalf: He keeps all his bones,
verses.secondHalf: so that not one of them is broken.

verses.firstHalf: But evil shall slay the ungodly,
verses.secondHalf: and those who hate the righteous shall be desolate.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD delivers the souls of his servants,
verses.secondHalf: and all those who put their trust in him shall not be destitute.

verses.firstHalf: Contend, O LORD, with those who contend with me,
verses.secondHalf: and fight against those who fight against me.

verses.firstHalf: Take up the shield and buckler,
verses.secondHalf: and stand up to help me.

verses.firstHalf: Bring forth the spear and bar the way against those who pursue me;
verses.secondHalf: say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”

verses.firstHalf: Let them be confounded and put to shame who seek after my life;
verses.secondHalf: let them be turned back and brought to confusion who imagine evil against me.

verses.firstHalf: Let them be as the chaff before the wind,
verses.secondHalf: and let the angel of the LORD scatter them.

verses.firstHalf: Let their way be dark and slippery,
verses.secondHalf: and let the angel of the LORD pursue them.

verses.firstHalf: For they have secretly laid their net to destroy me without a cause;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, without a cause have they made a pit to take away my life.

verses.firstHalf: Let sudden destruction come upon them unawares, and the net, which they have laid secretly, catch themselves,
verses.secondHalf: that they may fall into their own trouble.

verses.firstHalf: Then shall my soul be joyful in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: I shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.firstHalf: All my bones shall say, “LORD, who is like you? You deliver the poor from those who are too strong for them;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, the poor and those who are in misery from those who rob them.”

verses.firstHalf: Malicious witnesses rise up;
verses.secondHalf: they charge me with matters I know nothing about.

verses.firstHalf: They repay me evil for good,
verses.secondHalf: to the great sorrow of my soul.

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, when they were sick, I put on sackcloth and humbled myself with fasting;
verses.secondHalf: I prayed with my whole heart, as if it had been my friend or my brother.

verses.firstHalf: I behaved myself as one who mourns for his mother;
verses.secondHalf: I was bowed down with heaviness of heart.

verses.firstHalf: But in my adversity, they rejoiced and gathered themselves together;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, those who struck me came together against me, and I had no rest; they tore at me, and would not cease.

verses.firstHalf: When I stumbled they mocked me exceedingly,
verses.secondHalf: and gnashed at me with their teeth.

verses.firstHalf: Lord, how long will you look on this?
verses.secondHalf: O deliver me from the calamities they bring upon me, and my life from the lions.

verses.firstHalf: So will I give you thanks in the great congregation;
verses.secondHalf: I will praise you among many people.

verses.firstHalf: O let not those who are my enemies triumph over me deceitfully;
verses.secondHalf: neither let them wink with their eyes, those who hate me without a cause.

verses.firstHalf: For their talking is not for peace,
verses.secondHalf: but they imagine deceitful words against those who are quiet in the land.

verses.firstHalf: They open their mouths at me, and say,
verses.secondHalf: “Aha! Aha! We saw it with our own eyes!”

verses.firstHalf: This you have seen, O LORD.
verses.secondHalf: Hold not your tongue then; be not far from me, O Lord.

verses.firstHalf: Awake, and stand up to judge my case;
verses.secondHalf: avenge my cause, my God and my Lord.

verses.firstHalf: Judge me, O LORD my God, according to your righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and let them not triumph over me.

verses.firstHalf: Let them not say in their hearts, “Aha! We have what we want!”
verses.secondHalf: Neither let them say, “We have devoured him.”

verses.firstHalf: Let them be put to confusion and shame who rejoice at my trouble;
verses.secondHalf: let them be clothed with shame and dishonor who boast against me.

verses.firstHalf: Let them be glad and rejoice who favor my righteous cause;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, let them say always, “Great is the LORD, who takes pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.”

verses.firstHalf: And as for my tongue, it shall be talking of your righteousness
verses.secondHalf: and of your praise all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: My heart shows me the wickedness of the ungodly;
verses.secondHalf: there is no fear of God before his eyes.

verses.firstHalf: For he flatters himself in his own sight,
verses.secondHalf: until his abominable sin is found out.

verses.firstHalf: The words of his mouth are unrighteous and full of deceit;
verses.secondHalf: he has left off behaving wisely and doing good.

verses.firstHalf: He imagines mischief upon his bed, and has set himself in no good way;
verses.secondHalf: neither does he abhor anything that is evil.

verses.firstHalf: Your mercy, O LORD, reaches to the heavens,
verses.secondHalf: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

verses.firstHalf: Your righteousness stands like the strong mountains; your judgments are like the great deep;
verses.secondHalf: you, LORD, shall save both man and beast.

verses.firstHalf: How excellent is your mercy, O God!
verses.secondHalf: The children of men shall take refuge under the shadow of your wings.

verses.firstHalf: They shall be satisfied with the plenteousness of your house,
verses.secondHalf: and you shall give them drink from your pleasures as out of a river.

verses.firstHalf: For with you is the well of life,
verses.secondHalf: and in your light shall we see light.

verses.firstHalf: O continue your loving-kindness to those who know you,
verses.secondHalf: and your righteousness to those who are true of heart.

verses.firstHalf: O let not the foot of the proud come against me,
verses.secondHalf: and let not the hand of the ungodly cast me down.

verses.firstHalf: There have they fallen, all those who work wickedness;
verses.secondHalf: they are cast down, and shall not be able to rise.

verses.firstHalf: Fret not yourself because of the ungodly,
verses.secondHalf: neither be envious of those who are evildoers.

verses.firstHalf: For they shall soon be dried up like the grass,
verses.secondHalf: and be withered even as the green herb.

verses.firstHalf: Put your trust in the LORD, and do good;
verses.secondHalf: dwell in the land, and surely you shall be fed.

verses.firstHalf: Delight yourself in the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and he shall give you your heart’s desire.

verses.firstHalf: Commit your way unto the LORD and put your trust in him,
verses.secondHalf: and he shall bring it to pass.

verses.firstHalf: He shall make your righteousness as clear as the light
verses.secondHalf: and your just dealing as the noonday.

verses.firstHalf: Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for him;
verses.secondHalf: do not grieve yourself over the one whose way prospers, over the one who carries out evil counsels.

verses.firstHalf: Refrain from wrath, and let go of anger;
verses.secondHalf: fret not yourself, lest you be moved to do evil.

verses.firstHalf: For evildoers shall be rooted out,
verses.secondHalf: but those who wait patiently for the LORD, they shall inherit the land.

verses.firstHalf: Yet a little while, and the ungodly shall be clean gone;
verses.secondHalf: you shall look for their place, and they shall not be there.

verses.firstHalf: But the meek-spirited shall possess the land
verses.secondHalf: and shall be refreshed with an abundance of peace.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly plot against the just
verses.secondHalf: and gnash at them with their teeth.

verses.firstHalf: The Lord shall laugh at them in scorn,
verses.secondHalf: for he sees that their day is coming.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow
verses.secondHalf: to cast down the poor and needy, and to slay those who walk aright.

verses.firstHalf: Their sword shall go through their own heart,
verses.secondHalf: and their bow shall be broken.

verses.firstHalf: The little that the righteous has
verses.secondHalf: is better than great riches of the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: For the arms of the ungodly shall be broken,
verses.secondHalf: but the LORD upholds the righteous.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD knows the days of the godly,
verses.secondHalf: and their inheritance shall endure for ever.

verses.firstHalf: They shall not be confounded in perilous times,
verses.secondHalf: and in the days of famine they shall have enough.

verses.firstHalf: As for the ungodly, they shall perish, and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed as in a fiery furnace;
verses.secondHalf: even as smoke shall they vanish away.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly borrow and do not repay,
verses.secondHalf: but the righteous are merciful and generous.

verses.firstHalf: Those who are blessed by God shall possess the land,
verses.secondHalf: but those who are cursed by him shall be rooted out.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD orders a man’s steps;
verses.secondHalf: he makes his footsteps sure and preserves him on his path.

verses.firstHalf: Though he fall, he shall not be cast down,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD upholds him with his hand.

verses.firstHalf: I have been young, and now I am old,
verses.secondHalf: yet I never saw the righteous forsaken, nor his children begging bread.

verses.firstHalf: The righteous is ever merciful in lending,
verses.secondHalf: and his seed shall be blessed.

verses.firstHalf: Flee from evil, and do that which is good,
verses.secondHalf: and dwell in the land for ever.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD loves that which is right;
verses.secondHalf: he forsakes not those who are godly, and they are preserved for ever.

verses.firstHalf: The unrighteous shall be punished;
verses.secondHalf: as for the seed of the ungodly, it shall be rooted out.

verses.firstHalf: The righteous shall inherit the land
verses.secondHalf: and dwell therein for ever.

verses.firstHalf: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
verses.secondHalf: and his tongue talks of judgment.

verses.firstHalf: The law of his God is in his heart,
verses.secondHalf: and his footsteps shall not falter.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly lie in wait for the righteous
verses.secondHalf: and seek occasion to slay him.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD will not leave him in their hand,
verses.secondHalf: nor allow him to be condemned when he is judged.

verses.firstHalf: Hope in the LORD, and keep his way, and he shall exalt you so that you shall possess the land;
verses.secondHalf: when the ungodly perish, you shall see it.

verses.firstHalf: I myself have seen the ungodly in great power,
verses.secondHalf: and flourishing like a tree in full leaf.

verses.firstHalf: I went by, and behold, they were gone;
verses.secondHalf: I sought them, but their place could nowhere be found.

verses.firstHalf: Mark the blameless, and take heed of the upright,
verses.secondHalf: for there is a future for the peaceable.

verses.firstHalf: As for the transgressors, they shall perish together,
verses.secondHalf: and the end of the ungodly is that they shall be rooted out at the last.

verses.firstHalf: But the salvation of the righteous comes from the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: who is also their strength in the time of trouble.

verses.firstHalf: And the LORD shall stand by them and save them;
verses.secondHalf: he shall deliver them from the ungodly and shall save them, because they put their trust in him.

verses.firstHalf: Rebuke me not, O LORD, in your anger,
verses.secondHalf: neither chasten me in your weighty displeasure.

verses.firstHalf: For your arrows stick fast in me,
verses.secondHalf: and your hand presses me hard.

verses.firstHalf: There is no health in my flesh, because of your displeasure;
verses.secondHalf: neither is there any rest in my bones, by reason of my sin.

verses.firstHalf: For my iniquities have gone over my head
verses.secondHalf: and are like a heavy burden, too much for me to bear.

verses.firstHalf: My wounds stink and fester,
verses.secondHalf: by reason of my foolishness.

verses.firstHalf: I am brought into such great trouble and misery
verses.secondHalf: that I go about mourning all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: For my loins are filled with burning,
verses.secondHalf: and there is no wholeness in my body.

verses.firstHalf: I am feeble and sorely smitten;
verses.secondHalf: I have roared because of the tumult of my heart.

verses.firstHalf: Lord, you know all my desire,
verses.secondHalf: and my groaning is not hidden from you.

verses.firstHalf: My heart is panting, my strength has failed me,
verses.secondHalf: and the sight of my eyes is gone from me.

verses.firstHalf: My friends and my neighbors turn away from my trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and my kinsmen stand afar off.

verses.firstHalf: Those also who seek after my life lay snares for me,
verses.secondHalf: and those who go about to do me evil talk of wickedness and imagine deceit all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: As for me, I am like the deaf who do not hear,
verses.secondHalf: and as one who is mute, who does not open his mouth.

verses.firstHalf: I have become like a man who hears not,
verses.secondHalf: and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

verses.firstHalf: For in you, O LORD, have I put my trust;
verses.secondHalf: you shall answer for me, O Lord my God.

verses.firstHalf: I have said, “Let not my enemies triumph over me,”
verses.secondHalf: for when my foot slipped, they rejoiced greatly over me.

verses.firstHalf: Truly, I am about to fall,
verses.secondHalf: and my pain is ever with me.

verses.firstHalf: For I will confess my wickedness,
verses.secondHalf: and be sorry for my sin.

verses.firstHalf: But my enemies live, and are mighty,
verses.secondHalf: and those who hate me wrongfully are many in number.

verses.firstHalf: Those also who repay evil for good are against me,
verses.secondHalf: because I follow that which is good.

verses.firstHalf: Forsake me not, O LORD my God;
verses.secondHalf: O be not far from me.

verses.firstHalf: Make haste to help me,
verses.secondHalf: O Lord God of my salvation.

verses.firstHalf: I said, “I will take heed to my ways,
verses.secondHalf: that I may not offend with my tongue.

verses.firstHalf: I will keep my mouth as with a bridle
verses.secondHalf: while the ungodly are in my sight.”

verses.firstHalf: I held my tongue and spoke nothing;
verses.secondHalf: I kept silence, even from good words; but it was pain and grief to me.
