verses.firstHalf: I consider the days of old;
verses.secondHalf: I call to remembrance the years that are past.

verses.firstHalf: In the night I commune with my own heart;
verses.secondHalf: I meditate and search my spirit.

verses.firstHalf: Will the Lord cast me off for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and will he no more show his favor?

verses.firstHalf: Is his mercy gone for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and has his promise come utterly to an end for evermore?

verses.firstHalf: Has God forgotten to be gracious,
verses.secondHalf: and will he withhold his loving-kindness in displeasure?

verses.firstHalf: And I said, “Has his right hand become weak?
verses.secondHalf: Has the hand of the Most High lost its strength?”

verses.firstHalf: I will remember the works of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and call to mind your wonders of old time.

verses.firstHalf: I will think also of all your works,
verses.secondHalf: and my talk shall be of your deeds.

verses.firstHalf: Your way, O God, is holy;
verses.secondHalf: who is so great a God as our God?

verses.firstHalf: You are the God who does wonders,
verses.secondHalf: and have declared your power among the peoples.

verses.firstHalf: You have mightily delivered your people,
verses.secondHalf: even the sons of Jacob and Joseph.

verses.firstHalf: The waters saw you, O God; the waters saw you and were afraid;
verses.secondHalf: the depths also were troubled.

verses.firstHalf: The clouds poured out water, the skies thundered,
verses.secondHalf: and your arrows flashed on every side.

verses.firstHalf: The voice of your thunder was heard in the whirlwind; the lightning lit up the world;
verses.secondHalf: the earth was moved and shook.

verses.firstHalf: Your way was in the sea, and your paths in the great waters,
verses.secondHalf: yet your footsteps were not seen.

verses.firstHalf: You led your people like sheep
verses.secondHalf: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

verses.firstHalf: Hear my teaching, O my people;
verses.secondHalf: incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

verses.firstHalf: I will open my mouth in a parable;
verses.secondHalf: I will utter dark sayings of old,

verses.firstHalf: Which we have heard and known,
verses.secondHalf: and such as our forefathers have told us,

verses.firstHalf: That we should not hide them from the children of the generations to come,
verses.secondHalf: but show the honor of the LORD, his mighty and wonderful works that he has done.

verses.firstHalf: He made a covenant with Jacob, and gave Israel a law,
verses.secondHalf: which he commanded our forefathers to teach their children,

verses.firstHalf: That their posterity might know it,
verses.secondHalf: and the children which were yet unborn;

verses.firstHalf: With the intent that when they came up
verses.secondHalf: they might show it to their children,

verses.firstHalf: That they might put their trust in God,
verses.secondHalf: and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments;

verses.firstHalf: And not be as their forefathers, a faithless and stubborn generation,
verses.secondHalf: a generation that did not set their heart aright, and whose spirit did not cleave steadfastly to God,

verses.firstHalf: Like the children of Ephraim, archers carrying bows,
verses.secondHalf: who turned back in the day of battle.

verses.firstHalf: They did not keep the covenant of God,
verses.secondHalf: and would not walk in his law,

verses.firstHalf: But forgot what he had done,
verses.secondHalf: and the wonderful works that he had shown them.

verses.firstHalf: Marvelous things he did in the sight of our forefathers,
verses.secondHalf: in the land of Egypt, even in the field of Zoan.

verses.firstHalf: He divided the sea and let them go through;
verses.secondHalf: he made the waters to stand in a heap.

verses.firstHalf: In the daytime he led them with a cloud,
verses.secondHalf: and all the night through with a light of fire.

verses.firstHalf: He split the hard rocks in the wilderness
verses.secondHalf: and gave them drink in abundance, as out of the great deep.

verses.firstHalf: He brought waters out of the stony rock,
verses.secondHalf: so that it gushed out like the rivers.

verses.firstHalf: Yet for all this they sinned more against him,
verses.secondHalf: and provoked the Most High in the wilderness.

verses.firstHalf: They tested God in their hearts
verses.secondHalf: and demanded food for their craving.

verses.firstHalf: They spoke against God, saying,
verses.secondHalf: “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, he smote the stony rock, so that water gushed out, and the streams overflowed;
verses.secondHalf: but can he give bread also, or provide meat for his people?”

verses.firstHalf: When the LORD heard this, he was full of wrath;
verses.secondHalf: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and there flared up fierce anger against Israel,

verses.firstHalf: Because they did not believe in God,
verses.secondHalf: and did not put their trust in his help.

verses.firstHalf: So he commanded the clouds above
verses.secondHalf: and opened the doors of heaven.

verses.firstHalf: He rained down manna upon them to eat
verses.secondHalf: and gave them food from heaven.

verses.firstHalf: So mortals ate the bread of angels;
verses.secondHalf: for he sent them food enough.

verses.firstHalf: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens,
verses.secondHalf: and through his power he brought in the south wind.

verses.firstHalf: He rained meat upon them as thick as dust
verses.secondHalf: and feathered fowl like the sand of the sea.

verses.firstHalf: He let it fall among their tents,
verses.secondHalf: even round about their habitations.

verses.firstHalf: So they ate and were well filled, for he gave them what they desired;
verses.secondHalf: they did not deny themselves their cravings,

verses.firstHalf: But while the food was yet in their mouths, the heavy wrath of God came upon them, and slew the mightiest of them,
verses.secondHalf: and struck down the young men of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: But for all this they sinned yet more,
verses.secondHalf: and did not believe his wondrous works.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore he brought their days to an end in vanity
verses.secondHalf: and their years in trouble.

verses.firstHalf: When he slew them, they sought him,
verses.secondHalf: and returned, and inquired after God.

verses.firstHalf: And they remembered that God was their rock,
verses.secondHalf: and the Most High God was their redeemer.

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, they flattered him with their mouth
verses.secondHalf: and spoke deceitfully to him with their tongue.

verses.firstHalf: For their heart was not fixed on him,
verses.secondHalf: neither did they continue steadfast in his covenant.

verses.firstHalf: But he was so merciful that he forgave their iniquities
verses.secondHalf: and did not destroy them.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, many times he turned his wrath away
verses.secondHalf: and would not permit his displeasure to arise.

verses.firstHalf: For he considered that they were but flesh,
verses.secondHalf: that they were even as the wind that passes away and comes not again.

verses.firstHalf: Many times they provoked him in the wilderness
verses.secondHalf: and grieved him in the desert.

verses.firstHalf: They turned back, and tested God,
verses.secondHalf: and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: They remembered not his power,
verses.secondHalf: nor the day when he delivered them from the hand of the enemy,

verses.firstHalf: How he had wrought his miracles in Egypt
verses.secondHalf: and his wonders in the field of Zoan.

verses.firstHalf: He turned their waters into blood,
verses.secondHalf: so that they might not drink of the rivers.

verses.firstHalf: He sent flies among them, which devoured them up,
verses.secondHalf: and frogs to destroy them.

verses.firstHalf: He gave their fruit to the grasshopper
verses.secondHalf: and their labor to the locust.

verses.firstHalf: He destroyed their vines with hailstones
verses.secondHalf: and their sycamore trees with the frost.

verses.firstHalf: He smote their cattle also with hailstones
verses.secondHalf: and their flocks with hot thunderbolts.

verses.firstHalf: He cast upon them the furiousness of his wrath, anger, displeasure, and trouble,
verses.secondHalf: sending these destroying angels among them.

verses.firstHalf: He made a way for his indignation, and did not spare their soul from death,
verses.secondHalf: but gave their life over to the pestilence,

verses.firstHalf: And smote all the firstborn in Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: the firstfruits of their strength in the dwellings of Ham.

verses.firstHalf: But as for his own people, he led them forth like sheep
verses.secondHalf: and carried them in the wilderness like a flock.

verses.firstHalf: He brought them out safely, and they were not afraid;
verses.secondHalf: he overwhelmed their enemies with the sea,

verses.firstHalf: And brought them within the borders of his holy land,
verses.secondHalf: to his mountain which he obtained with his right hand.

verses.firstHalf: He cast out the nations before them,
verses.secondHalf: and caused their land to be divided among them for an inheritance, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.

verses.firstHalf: But they tested and displeased the Most High God,
verses.secondHalf: and did not keep his testimonies,

verses.firstHalf: But turned their backs and fell away like their forefathers,
verses.secondHalf: twisting aside like a broken bow.

verses.firstHalf: For they grieved him with their hill altars
verses.secondHalf: and provoked him to displeasure with their images.

verses.firstHalf: When God heard this, he was full of wrath
verses.secondHalf: and utterly rejected Israel,

verses.firstHalf: So that he forsook the tabernacle in Shiloh,
verses.secondHalf: even the tent that he had pitched among them.

verses.firstHalf: He delivered the ark into captivity,
verses.secondHalf: and his glory into the enemy’s hand.

verses.firstHalf: He gave his people over to the sword
verses.secondHalf: and was angry with his inheritance.

verses.firstHalf: Fire consumed their young men,
verses.secondHalf: and their maidens had no marriage songs.

verses.firstHalf: Their priests were slain with the sword,
verses.secondHalf: and their widows made no lamentation.

verses.firstHalf: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,
verses.secondHalf: and like a warrior recovered from wine.

verses.firstHalf: He drove his enemies backward
verses.secondHalf: and put them to a perpetual shame.

verses.firstHalf: He rejected the tabernacle of Joseph
verses.secondHalf: and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,

verses.firstHalf: But chose the tribe of Judah,
verses.secondHalf: even the hill of Zion which he loved.

verses.firstHalf: And there he built his sanctuary, like the heights of heaven,
verses.secondHalf: like the earth which he had established for ever.

verses.firstHalf: He chose David his servant,
verses.secondHalf: and took him away from the sheepfolds;

verses.firstHalf: As he was following the ewes that were great with young, God took him,
verses.secondHalf: that he might feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.

verses.firstHalf: So he fed them with a faithful and true heart,
verses.secondHalf: and guided them with skillful hands.

verses.firstHalf: O God, the nations have come into your inheritance;
verses.secondHalf: they have defiled your holy temple, and made Jerusalem a heap of stones.

verses.firstHalf: The dead bodies of your servants have they given to be meat for the birds of the air,
verses.secondHalf: and the flesh of your saints to the beasts of the land.

verses.firstHalf: Their blood have they shed like water on every side of Jerusalem,
verses.secondHalf: and there was no one to bury them.

verses.firstHalf: We have become a reproach to our enemies,
verses.secondHalf: an object of scorn and derision to those who are round about us.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, how long will you be angry?
verses.secondHalf: Shall your jealousy burn like fire for ever?

verses.firstHalf: Pour out your indignation upon the nations that have not known you,
verses.secondHalf: and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon your Name.

verses.firstHalf: For they have devoured Jacob
verses.secondHalf: and laid waste his dwelling place.

verses.firstHalf: O remember not our past sins, but have mercy on us speedily,
verses.secondHalf: for we have come to great misery.

verses.firstHalf: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your Name;
verses.secondHalf: O deliver us and forgive our sins for your Name’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: Why do the nations say,
verses.secondHalf: “Where now is their God?”

verses.firstHalf: O let the vengeance of your servants’  blood that is shed
verses.secondHalf: be known in our sight among the nations.

verses.firstHalf: O let the sorrowful sighing of the prisoners come before you;
verses.secondHalf: according to the greatness of your power, preserve those who are condemned to die.

verses.firstHalf: As for the blasphemy by which our neighbors have blasphemed you,
verses.secondHalf: repay them, O Lord, seven-fold into their bosoms.

verses.firstHalf: So we, who are your people and the sheep of your pasture, shall give you thanks for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and will always be showing forth your praise from generation to generation.

verses.firstHalf: Hear, O Shepherd of Israel, you that lead Joseph like a sheep;
verses.secondHalf: show yourself also, you that sit upon the cherubim.

verses.firstHalf: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
verses.secondHalf: stir up your strength and come to help us.

verses.firstHalf: Restore us again, O God;
verses.secondHalf: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.secondHalf: how long will you be angry with your people that pray?

verses.firstHalf: You feed them with the bread of tears
verses.secondHalf: and give them plenteous tears to drink.

verses.firstHalf: You have made us the derision of our neighbors,
verses.secondHalf: and our enemies laugh us to scorn.

verses.firstHalf: Restore us again, O God of hosts;
verses.secondHalf: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.firstHalf: You have brought a vine out of Egypt;
verses.secondHalf: you have cast out the nations and planted it.

verses.firstHalf: You made room for it,
verses.secondHalf: and when it had taken root, it filled the land.

verses.firstHalf: The hills were covered with the shadow of it,
verses.secondHalf: and the boughs thereof were like the mighty cedar trees.

verses.firstHalf: It stretched out its branches to the sea
verses.secondHalf: and its boughs to the river.

verses.firstHalf: Why have you broken down its hedge,
verses.secondHalf: so that all those who go by pluck off its grapes?

verses.firstHalf: The wild boar out of the wood roots it up,
verses.secondHalf: and the wild beasts of the field devour it.

verses.firstHalf: Turn again, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
verses.secondHalf: behold, and visit this vine,

verses.firstHalf: And the place of the vineyard that your right hand has planted,
verses.secondHalf: and the branch that you made so strong for yourself.

verses.firstHalf: As for those who burn it with fire and cut it down,
verses.secondHalf: let them perish at the rebuke of your countenance.

verses.firstHalf: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand
verses.secondHalf: and upon the son of man, whom you made so strong for yourself.

verses.firstHalf: And so we will not turn back from you;
verses.secondHalf: O let us live, and we shall call upon your Name.

verses.firstHalf: Restore us again, O LORD God of hosts;
verses.secondHalf: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be whole.

verses.firstHalf: O sing merrily unto God our strength;
verses.secondHalf: make a cheerful noise unto the God of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: Take the psalm, bring hither the timbrel,
verses.secondHalf: the merry harp with the lute.

verses.firstHalf: Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
verses.secondHalf: even in the time appointed, and on our solemn feast day.

verses.firstHalf: For this was made a statute for Israel
verses.secondHalf: and a law of the God of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: This he laid upon Joseph for a testimony,
verses.secondHalf: when he came out of the land of Egypt.

verses.firstHalf: “I eased his shoulder from the burden,
verses.secondHalf: and his hands were delivered from bearing the load.

verses.firstHalf: You called upon me in troubles, and I delivered you,
verses.secondHalf: and I answered you in the thundercloud and tested you at the waters of strife.

verses.firstHalf: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
verses.secondHalf: O Israel, if you will hearken unto me,

verses.firstHalf: There shall be no strange god among you,
verses.secondHalf: neither shall you worship any other god.

verses.firstHalf: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
verses.secondHalf: open your mouth wide, and I shall fill it.

verses.firstHalf: But my people would not hear my voice,
verses.secondHalf: and Israel would not obey me.

verses.firstHalf: So I gave them up to the stubbornness of their hearts,
verses.secondHalf: and let them follow their own imaginations.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that my people would have hearkened unto me,
verses.secondHalf: that Israel had walked in my ways.

verses.firstHalf: I would soon have put down their enemies
verses.secondHalf: and turned my hand against their adversaries.

verses.firstHalf: The haters of the LORD would humble themselves before him,
verses.secondHalf: and their time of punishment would endure for ever.

verses.firstHalf: But Israel would I feed with the finest wheat-flour,
verses.secondHalf: and with honey out of the stony rock would I satisfy him.”

verses.firstHalf: God stands in the council of princes;
verses.secondHalf: he is a Judge among gods.

verses.firstHalf: “How long will you give wrong judgment
verses.secondHalf: and accept the ungodly?

verses.firstHalf: Defend the poor and fatherless;
verses.secondHalf: see that those who are in need and necessity have what is right.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver the outcast and poor;
verses.secondHalf: save them from the hand of the ungodly.”

verses.firstHalf: They will not learn nor understand, but walk about in darkness;
verses.secondHalf: all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

verses.firstHalf: I have said, “You are gods,
verses.secondHalf: and you are all the children of the Most High;

verses.firstHalf: But you shall die like mortals,
verses.secondHalf: and fall like one of the princes.”

verses.firstHalf: Arise, O God, and judge the earth,
verses.secondHalf: for you shall take all nations for your inheritance.

verses.firstHalf: Hold not your tongue, O God; keep not silent,
verses.secondHalf: but rouse yourself, O God.

verses.firstHalf: For behold, your enemies murmur,
verses.secondHalf: and those who hate you have lifted up their head.

verses.firstHalf: They have conspired secretly against your people
verses.secondHalf: and taken counsel against your cherished ones.

verses.firstHalf: They have said, “Come, and let us wipe them out, that they may be no more a people,
verses.secondHalf: and that the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”

verses.firstHalf: For they have brought their heads together with one consent
verses.secondHalf: and are aligned against you:

verses.firstHalf: The tents of the Edomites and the Ishmaelites,
verses.secondHalf: the Moabites and Hagarenes,

verses.firstHalf: Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek,
verses.secondHalf: the Philistines with those who dwell at Tyre.

verses.firstHalf: Assyria also has joined with them,
verses.secondHalf: and has helped the children of Lot.

verses.firstHalf: But do to them as you did to the Midianites,
verses.secondHalf: to Sisera and to Jabin at the brook of Kishon,

verses.firstHalf: Who perished at Endor
verses.secondHalf: and became as dung on the earth.

verses.firstHalf: Make their princes like Oreb and Zeëb;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, make all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

verses.firstHalf: Who said, “Let us take for ourselves
verses.secondHalf: the pastures of God as our possession.”

verses.firstHalf: O my God, make them like whirling dust
verses.secondHalf: and like stubble before the wind,

verses.firstHalf: Like the fire that burns up the woods
verses.secondHalf: and like the flame that consumes the mountains.

verses.firstHalf: Pursue them even with your tempest,
verses.secondHalf: and make them afraid with your storm.

verses.firstHalf: Cover their faces with shame, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: that they may seek your Name.

verses.firstHalf: Let them be disgraced and dismayed ever more and more;
verses.secondHalf: let them be put to shame and perish.

verses.firstHalf: And they shall know that you, whose Name is the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: are alone the Most High over all the earth.

verses.firstHalf: How lovely are your dwellings,
verses.secondHalf: O LORD God of hosts!

verses.firstHalf: My soul has a desire and longing to enter into the courts of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: my heart and my flesh rejoice in the living God.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, the sparrow has found her a house, and the swallow a nest where she may lay her young,
verses.secondHalf: even your altars, O LORD of hosts, my King and my God.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are they who dwell in your house;
verses.secondHalf: they will be always praising you.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the one whose strength is in you,
verses.secondHalf: in whose heart are your ways,

verses.firstHalf: Who going through the valley of misery uses it for a well;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, the early rains fill the pools with water.

verses.firstHalf: They will go from strength to strength,
verses.secondHalf: and the God of gods shall be seen by them in Zion.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer;
verses.secondHalf: hearken, O God of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, O God, our defender,
verses.secondHalf: and look upon the face of your Anointed.

verses.firstHalf: For one day in your courts
verses.secondHalf: is better than a thousand;

verses.firstHalf: I would rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God
verses.secondHalf: than dwell in the tents of ungodliness.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD God is a light and defense;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD will give grace and honor, and no good thing shall he withhold from those who live a godly life.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God of hosts,
verses.secondHalf: blessed is the one who puts his trust in you.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, you have been gracious to your land;
verses.secondHalf: you have turned away the captivity of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: You have forgiven the offence of your people
verses.secondHalf: and covered all their sins.

verses.firstHalf: You have taken away all your displeasure
verses.secondHalf: and turned yourself from your wrathful indignation.

verses.firstHalf: Restore us then, O God our Savior,
verses.secondHalf: and let your anger cease from us.

verses.firstHalf: Will you be displeased at us for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and will you stretch out your wrath from one generation to another?

verses.firstHalf: Will you not turn again and quicken us,
verses.secondHalf: that your people may rejoice in you?

verses.firstHalf: Show us your mercy, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and grant us your salvation.

verses.firstHalf: I will hearken to what the LORD God will say,
verses.secondHalf: for he shall speak peace unto his people, and to his saints, that they turn not again.

verses.firstHalf: For his salvation is near to those who fear him,
verses.secondHalf: that glory may dwell in our land.

verses.firstHalf: Mercy and truth have met together;
verses.secondHalf: righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

verses.firstHalf: Truth shall flourish out of the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, the LORD shall show goodness,
verses.secondHalf: and our land shall give its increase.

verses.firstHalf: Righteousness shall go before him,
verses.secondHalf: and he shall direct his going in the way.

verses.firstHalf: Bow down your ear, O LORD, and hear me,
verses.secondHalf: for I am poor and in misery.

verses.firstHalf: Preserve my life, for I am faithful;
verses.secondHalf: my God, save your servant who puts his trust in you.

verses.firstHalf: Be merciful unto me, O Lord,
verses.secondHalf: for I will call daily upon you.

verses.firstHalf: Comfort the soul of your servant,
verses.secondHalf: for to you, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.

verses.firstHalf: For you, Lord, are good and gracious,
verses.secondHalf: and of great mercy to all those who call upon you.

verses.firstHalf: Give ear, LORD, unto my prayer,
verses.secondHalf: and attend to the voice of my humble supplications.

verses.firstHalf: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you,
verses.secondHalf: for you answer me when I call.

verses.firstHalf: Among the gods there is none like you, O Lord,
verses.secondHalf: nor are there any deeds like yours.

verses.firstHalf: All nations that you have made shall come and worship you, O Lord,
verses.secondHalf: and shall glorify your Name.

verses.firstHalf: For you are great and do wondrous things;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, you are God alone.

verses.firstHalf: Teach me your way, O LORD, and I will walk in your truth;
verses.secondHalf: O knit my heart to you, that I may fear your Name.

verses.firstHalf: I will thank you, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
verses.secondHalf: and will praise your Name for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: For great is your mercy toward me;
verses.secondHalf: you have delivered my life from the nethermost Pit.

verses.firstHalf: O God, the proud have risen up against me,
verses.secondHalf: and the company of violent men have sought after my life, and have not set you before their eyes.

verses.firstHalf: But you, O Lord God, are full of compassion and mercy,
verses.secondHalf: long-suffering, plenteous in goodness and truth.

verses.firstHalf: O turn then unto me, and have mercy upon me;
verses.secondHalf: give your strength unto your servant, and help the son of your handmaid.

verses.firstHalf: Show me some token of your favor, that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed,
verses.secondHalf: because you, LORD, have been my helper and comforter.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD loves the foundation which he has laid upon the holy hills;
verses.secondHalf: the gates of Zion are dearer to him than all the dwellings of Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: Very excellent things are spoken of you,
verses.secondHalf: O city of God.

verses.firstHalf: I will consider Egypt and Babylon
verses.secondHalf: among those who know me.

verses.firstHalf: Behold Philistia also, and Tyre, with Ethiopia;
verses.secondHalf: each one was born in her.

verses.firstHalf: And of Zion it shall be reported that each one was born in her,
verses.secondHalf: and the Most High shall establish her.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall record it when he registers the people,
verses.secondHalf: that each one was born there.

verses.firstHalf: The singers and the dancers also shall say,
verses.secondHalf: “All my fresh springs are in you.”

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you;
verses.secondHalf: O let my prayer enter into your presence; incline your ear to my call.

verses.firstHalf: For my soul is full of trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and my life draws nigh to the Grave.

verses.firstHalf: I am counted as one of those who go down into the pit,
verses.secondHalf: and I have become as one who has no strength.

verses.firstHalf: I have become like the dead, and like the slain who lie in the grave,
verses.secondHalf: whom you remember no more, and who are cut off from your hand.

verses.firstHalf: You have laid me in the lowest pit,
verses.secondHalf: in a place of darkness, and in the deep.

verses.firstHalf: Your indignation lies heavy upon me,
verses.secondHalf: and you have overwhelmed me with all your storms.

verses.firstHalf: You have put my friends far from me,
verses.secondHalf: and made me to be abhorred by them.

verses.firstHalf: I am in prison;
verses.secondHalf: I cannot go forth.

verses.firstHalf: My sight fails because of trouble;
verses.secondHalf: LORD, I have called daily upon you; I have stretched forth my hands unto you.

verses.firstHalf: Do you show wonders among the dead,
verses.secondHalf: or shall the dead rise up again and praise you?

verses.firstHalf: Shall your loving-kindness be shown in the grave,
verses.secondHalf: or your faithfulness in destruction?

verses.firstHalf: Shall your wondrous works be known in the dark,
verses.secondHalf: and your righteousness in the land where all things are forgotten?

verses.firstHalf: Unto you have I cried, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and early shall my prayer come before you.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, why do you cast off my soul
verses.secondHalf: and hide your face from me?

verses.firstHalf: I am in misery, like one who is at the point of death;
verses.secondHalf: even from my youth, your terrors have I suffered with a troubled mind.

verses.firstHalf: Your wrathful displeasure goes over me,
verses.secondHalf: and the fear of you has undone me.

verses.firstHalf: Daily they come round about me like water,
verses.secondHalf: and encompass me on every side.

verses.firstHalf: My companions and neighbors you have put away from me,
verses.secondHalf: and hidden my friends out of my sight.

verses.firstHalf: My song shall be always of the loving-kindness of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: with my mouth will I ever be proclaiming your faithfulness, from one generation to another.

verses.firstHalf: For I have said, “Mercy shall be built up for ever;
verses.secondHalf: your faithfulness shall be established in the heavens.”

verses.firstHalf: I have made a covenant with my chosen one;
verses.secondHalf: I have sworn to David my servant:

verses.firstHalf: “Your seed will I establish for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and set up your throne from one generation to another.”

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, the heavens will praise your wondrous works
verses.secondHalf: and your faithfulness in the assembly of the saints.

verses.firstHalf: For who in the clouds can be compared unto the LORD?
verses.secondHalf: And who among the gods is like unto the LORD?

verses.firstHalf: God is greatly to be feared in the council of the saints,
verses.secondHalf: and to be held in reverence by all those who are round about him.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God of hosts, who is like you?
verses.secondHalf: Your faithfulness, most mighty LORD, is round about you.

verses.firstHalf: You rule the raging of the sea;
verses.secondHalf: you still the waves when they arise.

verses.firstHalf: You have subdued Rahab of the deep, and destroyed her;
verses.secondHalf: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

verses.firstHalf: The heavens are yours; the earth also is yours;
verses.secondHalf: you laid the foundation of the world, and all that is in it.

verses.firstHalf: You have made the north and the south;
verses.secondHalf: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in your Name.

verses.firstHalf: You have a mighty arm;
verses.secondHalf: strong is your hand, and high is your right hand.

verses.firstHalf: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne;
verses.secondHalf: mercy and truth shall go before your face.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are the people, O LORD, who rejoice in you;
verses.secondHalf: they shall walk in the light of your countenance.

verses.firstHalf: Their delight shall be in your Name all the day long,
verses.secondHalf: and in your righteousness shall they make their boast.

verses.firstHalf: For you are the glory of their strength,
verses.secondHalf: and by your favor you shall lift up our might.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD is our defense;
verses.secondHalf: the Holy One of Israel is our King.

verses.firstHalf: You spoke in a vision to your saints, and said,
verses.secondHalf: “I have set the crown upon one who is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

verses.firstHalf: I have found David my servant;
verses.secondHalf: with my holy oil have I anointed him.

verses.firstHalf: My hand shall hold him fast,
verses.secondHalf: and my arm shall strengthen him.

verses.firstHalf: The enemy shall not be able to do him violence;
verses.secondHalf: the son of wickedness shall not hurt him.

verses.firstHalf: I will smite his foes before his face
verses.secondHalf: and strike down those who hate him.

verses.firstHalf: My faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him,
verses.secondHalf: and in my Name shall his horn be exalted.

verses.firstHalf: I will give him dominion over the sea,
verses.secondHalf: and with his right hand shall he rule the rivers.

verses.firstHalf: He shall say to me, “You are my Father,
verses.secondHalf: my God, and the rock of my salvation.”

verses.firstHalf: And I will make him my firstborn,
verses.secondHalf: higher than the kings of the earth.

verses.firstHalf: My mercy will I keep for him for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

verses.firstHalf: His seed will I make to endure for ever
verses.secondHalf: and his throne as the days of heaven.

verses.firstHalf: But if his children forsake my law,
verses.secondHalf: and do not walk in my judgments,

verses.firstHalf: If they break my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
verses.secondHalf: I will punish their offenses with the rod, and their sin with scourges.

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, my loving-kindness I will not utterly take from him,
verses.secondHalf: nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

verses.firstHalf: My covenant I will not break,
verses.secondHalf: nor alter the word that has gone out of my lips.

verses.firstHalf: I have sworn once by my holiness
verses.secondHalf: that I will not fail David.

verses.firstHalf: His seed shall endure for ever
verses.secondHalf: and his throne as the sun before me.

verses.firstHalf: It shall endure for evermore as the moon,
verses.secondHalf: and as the faithful witness in the heavens.

verses.firstHalf: But you have rejected and forsaken your Anointed;
verses.secondHalf: you are full of wrath against him.

verses.firstHalf: You have broken the covenant with your servant;
verses.secondHalf: you have defiled his crown and cast it to the ground.

verses.firstHalf: You have overthrown all his walls
verses.secondHalf: and broken down his strongholds.

verses.firstHalf: All those who go by plunder him,
verses.secondHalf: and he has become a reproach to his neighbors.

verses.firstHalf: You have exalted the right hand of his enemies,
verses.secondHalf: and made all his adversaries rejoice.

verses.firstHalf: You have turned back the edge of his sword
verses.secondHalf: and have not given him victory in the battle.

verses.firstHalf: You have taken away his glory
verses.secondHalf: and cast his throne down to the ground.

verses.firstHalf: The days of his youth you have shortened
verses.secondHalf: and covered him with dishonor.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, how long will you utterly hide yourself?
verses.secondHalf: How long shall your wrath burn like fire?

verses.firstHalf: O remember how short my time is;
verses.secondHalf: why have you made all people for nought?

verses.firstHalf: What man is there who lives and shall not see death,
verses.secondHalf: and shall deliver his soul from the power of the Grave?

verses.firstHalf: Lord, where are your loving-kindnesses of old,
verses.secondHalf: which you swore to David in your faithfulness?

verses.firstHalf: Remember, Lord, how your servants are reproached,
verses.secondHalf: and how I bear in my bosom the rebukes of many people;

verses.firstHalf: Remember how your enemies have reproached you, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: how they have called after your Anointed King with cries of scorn.

verses.firstHalf: Praised be the LORD for evermore.
verses.secondHalf: Amen and Amen.

verses.firstHalf: Lord, you have been our refuge
verses.secondHalf: from one generation to another.

verses.firstHalf: Before the mountains were brought forth, or the earth and the world were made,
verses.secondHalf: you are God from everlasting, and world without end.

verses.firstHalf: You turn man back to the dust;
verses.secondHalf: you say, “Return, O children of men.”

verses.firstHalf: For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday,
verses.secondHalf: even as a day that is past.

verses.firstHalf: You scatter them as a night-watch that comes quickly to an end;
verses.secondHalf: they are even as a dream and fade away.

verses.firstHalf: They are like the grass, which in the morning is green,
verses.secondHalf: but in the evening is dried up and withered.

verses.firstHalf: For we consume away in your displeasure
verses.secondHalf: and are afraid at your wrathful indignation.

verses.firstHalf: You have set our misdeeds before you,
verses.secondHalf: and our secret sins in the light of your countenance.

verses.firstHalf: For when you are angry, all our days are gone;
verses.secondHalf: we bring our years to an end, as a tale that is told.

verses.firstHalf: The days of our life are seventy years, and though some be so strong that they come to eighty years,
verses.secondHalf: yet is their span but labor and sorrow; so soon it passes away, and we are gone.

verses.firstHalf: But who regards the power of your wrath,
verses.secondHalf: and who considers the fierceness of your anger?

verses.firstHalf: So teach us to number our days,
verses.secondHalf: that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.

verses.firstHalf: Turn again, O LORD, and tarry not;
verses.secondHalf: be gracious unto your servants.

verses.firstHalf: O satisfy us with your mercy in the morning;
verses.secondHalf: so shall we rejoice and be glad all the days of our life.

verses.firstHalf: Comfort us again, according to the measure of the days that you have afflicted us,
verses.secondHalf: and for the years in which we have suffered adversity.

verses.firstHalf: Show your servants your work
verses.secondHalf: and their children your glory.

verses.firstHalf: And may the grace of the Lord our God be upon us;
verses.secondHalf: prosper the work of our hands; O prosper our handiwork.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever dwells under the defense of the Most High
verses.secondHalf: shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.

verses.firstHalf: I will say unto the LORD, “You are my refuge and my stronghold,
verses.secondHalf: my God in whom I will trust.”

verses.firstHalf: For he shall deliver you from the snare of the hunter
verses.secondHalf: and from the deadly pestilence.

verses.firstHalf: He shall defend you under his wings, and you shall be safe under his feathers;
verses.secondHalf: his faithfulness and truth shall be your shield and buckler.

verses.firstHalf: You shall not be afraid of any terror by night,
verses.secondHalf: nor of the arrow that flies by day,

verses.firstHalf: Of the pestilence that walks in darkness,
verses.secondHalf: nor of the sickness that destroys at noonday.

verses.firstHalf: A thousand shall fall beside you, and ten thousand at your right hand,
verses.secondHalf: but it shall not come near you.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, with your eyes you shall behold
verses.secondHalf: and see the reward of the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: Because you have said, “The LORD is my refuge,”
verses.secondHalf: and have made the Most High your stronghold,

verses.firstHalf: There shall no evil happen to you,
verses.secondHalf: neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.

verses.firstHalf: For he shall give his angels charge over you,
verses.secondHalf: to keep you in all your ways.

verses.firstHalf: They shall bear you in their hands,
verses.secondHalf: that you hurt not your foot against a stone.

verses.firstHalf: You shall tread upon the lion and adder;
verses.secondHalf: the young lion and the serpent you shall trample under your feet.

verses.firstHalf: “Because he has set his love upon me, therefore I will deliver him;
verses.secondHalf: I will lift him up, because he has known my Name.

verses.firstHalf: He shall call upon me, and I will hear him;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, I am with him in trouble; I will deliver him and bring him honor.

verses.firstHalf: With long life I will satisfy him,
verses.secondHalf: and show him my salvation.”

verses.firstHalf: It is a good thing to give thanks unto the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and to sing praises unto your Name, O Most High,

verses.firstHalf: To tell of your loving-kindness early in the morning,
verses.secondHalf: and of your faithfulness in the night season,

verses.firstHalf: Upon an instrument of ten strings and upon the lute,
verses.secondHalf: with the sound of melody upon the harp.

verses.firstHalf: For you, LORD, have made me glad by your deeds,
verses.secondHalf: and I will shout for joy because of your handiwork.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, how glorious are your works;
verses.secondHalf: your thoughts are very deep.

verses.firstHalf: The dull of heart does not consider this,
verses.secondHalf: and a fool does not understand it:

verses.firstHalf: Though the ungodly are as green as the grass, and though all the workers of wickedness flourish,
verses.secondHalf: they shall be destroyed for ever; but you, LORD, are the Most High for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: For lo, your enemies, O LORD, lo, your enemies shall perish,
verses.secondHalf: and all the workers of wickedness shall be destroyed.

verses.firstHalf: But my horn shall be exalted like the horns of wild bulls;
verses.secondHalf: for I am anointed with fresh oil.

verses.firstHalf: My eye also shall see its desire upon my enemies,
verses.secondHalf: and my ear shall hear with joy the end of the wicked who rise up against me.

verses.firstHalf: The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree,
verses.secondHalf: and shall spread abroad like a cedar in Lebanon.

verses.firstHalf: Those who are planted in the house of the LORD
verses.secondHalf: shall flourish in the courts of our God.

verses.firstHalf: They also shall bring forth fruit in their old age,
verses.secondHalf: and shall be green and full of sap,

verses.firstHalf: That they may show how upright the LORD is,
verses.secondHalf: my rock, in whom there is no unrighteousness.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is King and has put on glorious apparel;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD has put on his apparel and girded himself with strength.

verses.firstHalf: He has made the round world so sure
verses.secondHalf: that it cannot be moved.

verses.firstHalf: Ever since the world began, your throne has been established;
verses.secondHalf: you are from everlasting.

verses.firstHalf: The floods have risen, O LORD; the floods have lifted up their voice;
verses.secondHalf: the floods have lifted up their waves.

verses.firstHalf: Mightier than the sound of many waters, mightier than the waves of the sea,
verses.secondHalf: the LORD who dwells on high is mightier.

verses.firstHalf: Your testimonies, O LORD, are very sure;
verses.secondHalf: holiness adorns your house for ever.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God to whom vengeance belongs,
verses.secondHalf: O God to whom vengeance belongs, show yourself.

verses.firstHalf: Arise, O Judge of the world,
verses.secondHalf: and reward the proud according to their deserving.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, how long shall the ungodly,
verses.secondHalf: how long shall the ungodly triumph?

verses.firstHalf: How long shall all evildoers speak so disdainfully
verses.secondHalf: and make such proud boasting?

verses.firstHalf: They smite down your people, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and trouble your heritage.

verses.firstHalf: They murder the widow and the stranger,
verses.secondHalf: and put the fatherless to death.

verses.firstHalf: And yet they say, “The LORD shall not see,
verses.secondHalf: neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.”

verses.firstHalf: Take heed, you unwise among the people;
verses.secondHalf: O you fools, when will you understand?

verses.firstHalf: He who planted the ear, shall he not hear?
verses.secondHalf: Or he who made the eye, shall he not see?

verses.firstHalf: Or he who nurtures the nations,
verses.secondHalf: he who teaches humanity knowledge, shall he not punish?

verses.firstHalf: The LORD knows the thoughts of man,
verses.secondHalf: that they are but vain.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the one whom you chasten, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and whom you teach your law,

verses.firstHalf: That you may give him patience in time of adversity,
verses.secondHalf: until a pit is dug for the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD will not fail his people,
verses.secondHalf: neither will he forsake his inheritance,

verses.firstHalf: But righteousness shall return to the place of judgment,
verses.secondHalf: and all those who are true of heart shall follow it.

verses.firstHalf: Who will rise up with me against the wicked,
verses.secondHalf: or who will take my part against the evildoers?

verses.firstHalf: If the LORD had not helped me,
verses.secondHalf: my soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.

verses.firstHalf: But when I said, “My foot has slipped,”
verses.secondHalf: your mercy, O LORD, held me up.

verses.firstHalf: In the multitude of the sorrows that I had in my heart,
verses.secondHalf: your comforts refreshed my soul.

verses.firstHalf: Will you have anything to do with the council of wickedness,
verses.secondHalf: which turns evil into law?

verses.firstHalf: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous
verses.secondHalf: and condemn the innocent to death.

verses.firstHalf: But the LORD is my refuge,
verses.secondHalf: and my God is the rock of my confidence.

verses.firstHalf: He shall recompense them for their wickedness, and destroy them in their own malice;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, the LORD our God shall destroy them.

verses.firstHalf: O come, let us sing unto the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: let us heartily rejoice in the strength of our salvation.

verses.firstHalf: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving
verses.secondHalf: and show ourselves glad in him with psalms.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD is a great God
verses.secondHalf: and a great King above all gods.

verses.firstHalf: In his hand are all the depths of the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and the heights of the hills are his also.

verses.firstHalf: The sea is his, for he made it,
verses.secondHalf: and his hands prepared the dry land.

verses.firstHalf: O come, let us worship and fall down,
verses.secondHalf: and kneel before the LORD our Maker.

verses.firstHalf: For he is our God,
verses.secondHalf: and we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand.

verses.firstHalf: Today, if you will hear his voice, harden not your hearts
verses.secondHalf: as in the provocation, and as in the day of temptation in the wilderness,

verses.firstHalf: When your fathers tested me,
verses.secondHalf: and put me to the proof, though they had seen my works.

verses.firstHalf: Forty years long was I grieved with this generation and said,
verses.secondHalf: “It is a people that err in their hearts, for they have not known my ways,”

verses.firstHalf: Of whom I swore in my wrath
verses.secondHalf: that they should not enter into my rest.

verses.firstHalf: O sing unto the LORD a new song;
verses.secondHalf: sing unto the LORD, all the whole earth.

verses.firstHalf: Sing unto the LORD and praise his Name;
verses.secondHalf: tell of his salvation from day to day.

verses.firstHalf: Declare his honor to the nations,
verses.secondHalf: and his wonders to all peoples.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD is great, and highly to be praised;
verses.secondHalf: he is more to be feared than all gods.

verses.firstHalf: As for all the gods of the nations, they are but idols;
verses.secondHalf: but it is the LORD who made the heavens.

verses.firstHalf: Glory and majesty are before him;
verses.secondHalf: power and honor are in his sanctuary.

verses.firstHalf: Ascribe unto the LORD, O you families of the peoples,
verses.secondHalf: ascribe unto the LORD worship and power.

verses.firstHalf: Ascribe unto the LORD the honor due unto his Name;
verses.secondHalf: bring offerings and come into his courts.

verses.firstHalf: O worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness;
verses.secondHalf: let the whole earth stand in awe of him.

verses.firstHalf: Tell it out among the nations, “The LORD is King;
verses.secondHalf: it is he who has made the world so firm that it cannot be moved; he shall judge the peoples righteously.”

verses.firstHalf: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad;
verses.secondHalf: let the sea make a noise, and all that is therein.

verses.firstHalf: Let the field be joyful, and all that is in it;
verses.secondHalf: then shall all the trees of the wood rejoice before the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: For he comes, for he comes to judge the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and with righteousness to judge the world, and the peoples with his truth.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is King; let the earth be glad.
verses.secondHalf: Indeed, let the multitude of the isles be glad.

verses.firstHalf: Clouds and darkness are round about him;
verses.secondHalf: righteousness and judgment are the foundation of his throne.

verses.firstHalf: There goes a fire before him
verses.secondHalf: and burns up his enemies on every side.

verses.firstHalf: His lightnings gave light to the world;
verses.secondHalf: the earth saw it and was afraid.

verses.firstHalf: The hills melted like wax at the presence of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: at the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

verses.firstHalf: The heavens have declared his righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and all the people have seen his glory.

verses.firstHalf: Confounded be all those who worship carved images, and who delight in false gods;
verses.secondHalf: worship him, all you gods.

verses.firstHalf: Zion heard of it and rejoiced,
verses.secondHalf: and the daughters of Judah were glad, because of your judgments, O LORD.

verses.firstHalf: For you, LORD, are most high over all the earth;
verses.secondHalf: you are exalted far above all gods.

verses.firstHalf: O you who love the LORD, see that you hate the thing which is evil;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD preserves the souls of his saints; he shall deliver them from the hand of the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: A light has sprung up for the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: and joyful gladness for those who are truehearted.

verses.firstHalf: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous,
verses.secondHalf: and give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness.

verses.firstHalf: O sing unto the LORD a new song,
verses.secondHalf: for he has done marvelous things.

verses.firstHalf: With his own right hand and with his holy arm,
verses.secondHalf: he has won for himself the victory.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD declared his salvation;
verses.secondHalf: his righteousness has he openly shown in the sight of the nations.

verses.firstHalf: He has remembered his mercy and truth toward the house of Israel,
verses.secondHalf: and all the ends of the world have seen the salvation of our God.

verses.firstHalf: Show yourselves joyful in the LORD, all you lands;
verses.secondHalf: sing, rejoice, and give thanks.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD with the harp;
verses.secondHalf: sing with the harp a psalm of thanksgiving.

verses.firstHalf: With trumpets also and horns,
verses.secondHalf: O show yourselves joyful before the LORD, the King.

verses.firstHalf: Let the sea make a noise, and all that is in it,
verses.secondHalf: the round world, and those who dwell therein.

verses.firstHalf: Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the hills be joyful together before the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for he has come to judge the earth.

verses.firstHalf: With righteousness shall he judge the world,
verses.secondHalf: and the peoples with equity.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is King; let the peoples tremble;
verses.secondHalf: he sits between the cherubim; let the earth shake.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is great in Zion
verses.secondHalf: and high above all peoples.

verses.firstHalf: They shall give thanks unto his Name, which is great and wonderful;
verses.secondHalf: holy is he and mighty, a King who loves justice.

verses.firstHalf: You have established equity;
verses.secondHalf: you have executed judgment and righteousness in Jacob.

verses.firstHalf: O magnify the LORD our God,
verses.secondHalf: and fall down before his footstool, for he is holy.

verses.firstHalf: Moses and Aaron among his priests, and Samuel among those who call upon his Name,
verses.secondHalf: they called upon the LORD, and he heard them.

verses.firstHalf: He spoke to them out of the cloudy pillar,
verses.secondHalf: for they kept his testimonies and the law that he gave them.

verses.firstHalf: You heard them, O LORD our God;
verses.secondHalf: you forgave them, O God, yet punished their evildoings.

verses.firstHalf: O magnify the LORD our God, and worship him upon his holy hill,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD our God is holy.

verses.firstHalf: O be joyful in the LORD, all you lands;
verses.secondHalf: serve the LORD with gladness, and come before his presence with a song.

verses.firstHalf: Be assured that the LORD, he is God;
verses.secondHalf: it is he that has made us, and not we ourselves; we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.

verses.firstHalf: O go your way into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise;
verses.secondHalf: be thankful unto him, and speak good of his Name.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD is gracious, his mercy is everlasting,
verses.secondHalf: and his truth endures from generation to generation.

verses.firstHalf: My song shall be of mercy and judgment;
verses.secondHalf: unto you, O LORD, will I sing.

verses.firstHalf: O let me have understanding
verses.secondHalf: in the way of godliness.

verses.firstHalf: When will you come to me?
verses.secondHalf: I will walk in my house with integrity of heart.

verses.firstHalf: I will set no wicked thing before my eyes;
verses.secondHalf: I hate the sins of unfaithfulness; no such thing shall cleave to me.

verses.firstHalf: A crooked heart shall depart from me;
verses.secondHalf: I will not know a wicked person.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor,
verses.secondHalf: him will I destroy.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever has a proud look and an arrogant heart,
verses.secondHalf: I will not suffer him.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes shall look with favor upon the faithful in the land,
verses.secondHalf: that they may dwell with me.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever leads a godly life,
verses.secondHalf: he shall be my servant.

verses.firstHalf: No deceitful person shall dwell in my house;
verses.secondHalf: the one who tells lies shall not tarry in my sight.

verses.firstHalf: I shall soon destroy all the ungodly who are in the land,
verses.secondHalf: that I may root out all evildoers from the city of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Hear my prayer, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and let my cry come unto you.

verses.firstHalf: Hide not your face from me in the time of my trouble;
verses.secondHalf: incline your ear to me when I call; O hear me, and very soon.

verses.firstHalf: For my days are consumed like smoke,
verses.secondHalf: and my bones are burnt up as in a furnace.

verses.firstHalf: My heart is smitten and withered like grass,
verses.secondHalf: so that I forget to eat my bread.

verses.firstHalf: Because of the voice of my groaning,
verses.secondHalf: my bones will scarcely cleave to my flesh.

verses.firstHalf: I have become like an owl in the wilderness
verses.secondHalf: and like a screech-owl among the ruins.

verses.firstHalf: I am solitary, and lie sleepless because of my groaning;
verses.secondHalf: I am like a sparrow that sits alone upon the housetop.

verses.firstHalf: My enemies revile me all day long,
verses.secondHalf: and those who are enraged against me conspire to do me hurt.

verses.firstHalf: For I have eaten ashes as if they were bread
verses.secondHalf: and mingled my drink with weeping,

verses.firstHalf: Because of your indignation and wrath,
verses.secondHalf: for you have taken me up and cast me down.

verses.firstHalf: My days are gone like a shadow,
verses.secondHalf: and I am withered like grass.

verses.firstHalf: But you, O LORD, shall endure for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and your remembrance throughout all generations.

verses.firstHalf: You shall arise and have mercy upon Zion,
verses.secondHalf: for it is time for you to have mercy upon her; indeed, the time has come.

verses.firstHalf: For your servants love her very stones,
verses.secondHalf: and are moved to pity to see her in the dust.

verses.firstHalf: The nations shall fear your Name, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and all the kings of the earth your majesty,

verses.firstHalf: When the LORD shall build up Zion,
verses.secondHalf: and when his glory shall appear,

verses.firstHalf: When he turns to the prayer of the destitute
verses.secondHalf: and despises not their plea.

verses.firstHalf: This shall be written for those that come after,
verses.secondHalf: and a people that shall yet be born shall praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: For he has looked down from his sanctuary;
verses.secondHalf: from the heavens the LORD has beheld the earth,

verses.firstHalf: That he might hear the groanings of those who are in captivity,
verses.secondHalf: and deliver those who are condemned to die,

verses.firstHalf: That they may declare the Name of the LORD in Zion,
verses.secondHalf: and his praises in Jerusalem;

verses.firstHalf: When the peoples are gathered together,
verses.secondHalf: and the kingdoms also, to serve the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: He brought down my strength before my time,
verses.secondHalf: and shortened my days.

verses.firstHalf: But I said, “O my God, take me not away in the midst of my days;
verses.secondHalf: for your years endure throughout all generations.”

verses.firstHalf: You, Lord, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.firstHalf: They shall perish, but you shall endure;
verses.secondHalf: they all shall wear out, as does a garment;

verses.firstHalf: And as a garment you shall change them, and they shall be changed;
verses.secondHalf: but you are the same, and your years shall not fail.

verses.firstHalf: The children of your servants shall continue,
verses.secondHalf: and their seed shall stand fast in your sight.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O my soul,
verses.secondHalf: and all that is within me, praise his holy Name.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O my soul,
verses.secondHalf: and forget not all his benefits:

verses.firstHalf: Who forgives all your sin
verses.secondHalf: and heals all your infirmities,

verses.firstHalf: Who saves your life from the pit
verses.secondHalf: and crowns you with mercy and loving-kindness,

verses.firstHalf: Who satisfies you with good things,
verses.secondHalf: renewing your youth like an eagle’s.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD executes righteousness and judgment
verses.secondHalf: for all those who are oppressed with wrong.

verses.firstHalf: He showed his ways to Moses,
verses.secondHalf: his works to the children of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is full of compassion and mercy,
verses.secondHalf: long-suffering and of great goodness.

verses.firstHalf: He will not always chide us,
verses.secondHalf: neither will he keep his anger for ever.

verses.firstHalf: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
verses.secondHalf: nor rewarded us according to our wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: For as the heavens are high above the earth,
verses.secondHalf: so great is his mercy also toward those who fear him.

verses.firstHalf: As far as the east is from the west,
verses.secondHalf: so far has he set our sins from us.

verses.firstHalf: As a father pities his own children,
verses.secondHalf: so is the LORD merciful to those who fear him.

verses.firstHalf: For he knows whereof we are made;
verses.secondHalf: he remembers that we are but dust.

verses.firstHalf: The days of man are as grass;
verses.secondHalf: he flourishes as a flower of the field.

verses.firstHalf: For as soon as the wind goes over it, it is gone,
verses.secondHalf: and its place shall know it no more.

verses.firstHalf: But the merciful goodness of the LORD endures for ever and ever upon those who fear him,
verses.secondHalf: and his righteousness upon children’s children,

verses.firstHalf: Even upon those who keep his covenant
verses.secondHalf: and think upon his commandments to do them.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has prepared his throne in heaven,
verses.secondHalf: and his kingdom rules over all.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD, you angels of his, you that excel in strength,
verses.secondHalf: you that fulfill his commandment, and hearken unto the voice of his words.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD, all you his hosts,
verses.secondHalf: you servants of his that do his pleasure.

verses.firstHalf: O speak good of the LORD, all you works of his, in all places of his dominion;
verses.secondHalf: praise the LORD, O my soul.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O my soul.
verses.secondHalf: O LORD my God, you have become exceedingly glorious; you are clothed with majesty and honor.

verses.firstHalf: You clothe yourself with light as with a garment,
verses.secondHalf: and spread out the heavens like a curtain.

verses.firstHalf: You lay the beams of your chambers in the waters,
verses.secondHalf: and make the clouds your chariot, and walk upon the wings of the wind.

verses.firstHalf: You make winds your messengers,
verses.secondHalf: and flames of fire your ministers.

verses.firstHalf: You laid the foundations of the earth,
verses.secondHalf: that it never should move at any time.

verses.firstHalf: You cover it with the deep as with a garment;
verses.secondHalf: the waters stand above the hills.

verses.firstHalf: At your rebuke they fled;
verses.secondHalf: at the voice of your thunder they hastened away.

verses.firstHalf: They went up as high as the hills, and down to the valleys beneath,
verses.secondHalf: even to the place you had appointed for them.

verses.firstHalf: You have set bounds for them which they shall not pass;
verses.secondHalf: neither shall they again cover the earth.

verses.firstHalf: You send the springs into the rivers,
verses.secondHalf: which run among the hills.

verses.firstHalf: All beasts of the field drink thereof,
verses.secondHalf: and the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

verses.firstHalf: Beside them shall the birds of the air have their habitation
verses.secondHalf: and sing among the branches.

verses.firstHalf: You water the hills from above;
verses.secondHalf: the earth is filled with the fruit of your works.

verses.firstHalf: You bring forth grass for the cattle,
verses.secondHalf: and plants for the service of mankind,

verses.firstHalf: That they may bring food out of the earth, and wine that makes glad the heart,
verses.secondHalf: and oil to make a cheerful countenance, and bread to strengthen the heart.

verses.firstHalf: The trees of the LORD also are full of sap,
verses.secondHalf: even the cedars of Lebanon which he planted,

verses.firstHalf: Wherein the birds make their nests,
verses.secondHalf: and the fir trees are a dwelling for the stork.

verses.firstHalf: The high hills are a refuge for the wild goats,
verses.secondHalf: and so are the stony cliffs for the rock badgers.

verses.firstHalf: You appointed the moon to mark the seasons,
verses.secondHalf: and the sun knows its going down.

verses.firstHalf: You make darkness that it may be night,
verses.secondHalf: in which all the beasts of the forest move.

verses.firstHalf: The lions, roaring after their prey,
verses.secondHalf: seek their meat from God.

verses.firstHalf: The sun arises, and they go away together,
verses.secondHalf: and lay themselves down in their dens.

verses.firstHalf: Man goes forth to his work,
verses.secondHalf: and to his labor until the evening.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, how manifold are your works;
verses.secondHalf: in wisdom you made them all; the earth is full of your creatures.

verses.firstHalf: So is the great and wide sea also,
verses.secondHalf: in which are things creeping innumerable, creatures both small and great.

verses.firstHalf: There go the ships, and there is that Leviathan,
verses.secondHalf: whom you made to take its pleasure therein.

verses.firstHalf: These all wait upon you,
verses.secondHalf: that you may give them food in due season.

verses.firstHalf: When you give it to them, they gather it,
verses.secondHalf: and when you open your hand, they are filled with good things.

verses.firstHalf: When you hide your face, they are troubled;
verses.secondHalf: when you take away their breath, they die, and are turned again to their dust.

verses.firstHalf: When you let your breath go forth, they shall be made,
verses.secondHalf: and you shall renew the face of the earth.

verses.firstHalf: The glorious majesty of the LORD shall endure for ever;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD shall rejoice in his works.

verses.firstHalf: He looks at the earth and it trembles;
verses.secondHalf: if he even touches the hills, they shall smoke.

verses.firstHalf: I will sing unto the LORD as long as I live;
verses.secondHalf: I will praise my God while I have my being,

verses.firstHalf: And so shall my words please him;
verses.secondHalf: my joy shall be in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: As for sinners, they shall perish from the earth, and the ungodly shall come to an end.
verses.secondHalf: Praise the LORD, O my soul. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Give thanks unto the LORD and call upon his Name;
verses.secondHalf: tell the peoples what things he has done.

verses.firstHalf: O let your songs be of him, and praise him,
verses.secondHalf: and let your speech be of all his wondrous works.

verses.firstHalf: Rejoice in his holy Name;
verses.secondHalf: let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

verses.firstHalf: Seek the LORD and his strength;
verses.secondHalf: seek his face evermore.

verses.firstHalf: Remember the marvelous works that he has done,
verses.secondHalf: his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

verses.firstHalf: O seed of Abraham his servant,
verses.secondHalf: O children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.firstHalf: He is the LORD our God;
verses.secondHalf: his judgments are in all the world.

verses.firstHalf: He has always been mindful of his covenant,
verses.secondHalf: and the promise that he made to a thousand generations,

verses.firstHalf: Even the covenant that he made with Abraham,
verses.secondHalf: and the oath that he swore to Isaac,

verses.firstHalf: Which he appointed to Jacob for a law,
verses.secondHalf: and to Israel for an everlasting testament,

verses.firstHalf: Saying, “To you will I give the land of Canaan
verses.secondHalf: to be the portion of your inheritance.”

verses.firstHalf: When there were yet but a few of them,
verses.secondHalf: and they were strangers in the land,

verses.firstHalf: And they wandered from nation to nation,
verses.secondHalf: and from one kingdom to another,

verses.firstHalf: He allowed no one to do them wrong,
verses.secondHalf: but reproved even kings for their sakes:

verses.firstHalf: “Do not touch my Anointed,
verses.secondHalf: and do my prophets no harm.”

verses.firstHalf: Moreover, he called for a famine in the land
verses.secondHalf: and destroyed all the provision of bread.

verses.firstHalf: But he had sent a man before them:
verses.secondHalf: Joseph, who was sold to be a bondservant,

verses.firstHalf: Whose feet they hurt in the stocks;
verses.secondHalf: they put an iron collar around his neck.

verses.firstHalf: Until the time came that his sayings were fulfilled,
verses.secondHalf: the word of the LORD tried him.

verses.firstHalf: The king sent and delivered him;
verses.secondHalf: the ruler of the people let him go free.

verses.firstHalf: He made him lord over his house,
verses.secondHalf: and ruler of all his possessions,

verses.firstHalf: That he might instruct his princes according to his will
verses.secondHalf: and teach his elders wisdom.

verses.firstHalf: Israel also came into Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: and Jacob was a stranger in the land of Ham.

verses.firstHalf: And he increased his people exceedingly,
verses.secondHalf: and made them stronger than their enemies,

verses.firstHalf: Whose heart he turned, so that they hated his people,
verses.secondHalf: and dealt deceitfully with his servants.

verses.firstHalf: Then he sent Moses his servant,
verses.secondHalf: and Aaron whom he had chosen,

verses.firstHalf: And they worked his signs among them,
verses.secondHalf: and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.firstHalf: He sent darkness, and it was dark;
verses.secondHalf: but they were not obedient to his word.

verses.firstHalf: He turned their waters into blood
verses.secondHalf: and caused their fish to die.

verses.firstHalf: Their land brought forth frogs,
verses.secondHalf: even in their kings’ chambers.

verses.firstHalf: He spoke the word, and there came all manner of flies,
verses.secondHalf: and gnats in all their borders.

verses.firstHalf: He gave them hailstones for rain,
verses.secondHalf: and flames of fire in their land.

verses.firstHalf: He smote their vines also, and their fig trees,
verses.secondHalf: and destroyed the trees that were in their borders.

verses.firstHalf: He spoke the word, and the grasshoppers came, and locusts innumerable,
verses.secondHalf: which ate up all the grass in their land and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.firstHalf: He smote all the firstborn in their land,
verses.secondHalf: even the firstfruits of all their strength.

verses.firstHalf: He brought forth Israel with silver and gold;
verses.secondHalf: in all their tribes there was not one who stumbled.

verses.firstHalf: Egypt was glad at their departing,
verses.secondHalf: for they were afraid of them.

verses.firstHalf: He spread out a cloud to be a covering,
verses.secondHalf: and fire to give light in the night season.

verses.firstHalf: At their desire he brought quail,
verses.secondHalf: and he filled them with the bread of heaven.

verses.firstHalf: He opened the rock, and the waters flowed out,
verses.secondHalf: so that rivers ran in the dry places.

verses.firstHalf: For he remembered his holy promise
verses.secondHalf: and Abraham his servant.

verses.firstHalf: And he brought forth his people with joy,
verses.secondHalf: and his chosen ones with gladness,

verses.firstHalf: And gave them the lands of the nations,
verses.secondHalf: and they took the labors of the peoples in possession,

verses.firstHalf: That they might keep his statutes
verses.secondHalf: and observe his laws. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.secondHalf: and his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who can express the mighty acts of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: or show forth all his praise?

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are those who act with justice,
verses.secondHalf: and who always do righteousness.

verses.firstHalf: Remember me, O LORD, according to the favor that you show to your people;
verses.secondHalf: O visit me with your salvation,

verses.firstHalf: That I may see the felicity of your chosen,
verses.secondHalf: and rejoice in the gladness of your people, and give thanks with your inheritance.

verses.firstHalf: We have sinned like our fathers;
verses.secondHalf: we have done wrong and dealt wickedly.

verses.firstHalf: Our fathers regarded not your wonders in Egypt, neither did they keep your great goodness in remembrance,
verses.secondHalf: but were disobedient at the sea, even at the Red Sea.

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, he saved them for his Name’s sake,
verses.secondHalf: that he might make his power known.

verses.firstHalf: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up;
verses.secondHalf: so he led them through the deep as through a wilderness.

verses.firstHalf: And he saved them from the adversary’s hand,
verses.secondHalf: and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.

verses.firstHalf: As for those who troubled them, the waters overwhelmed them;
verses.secondHalf: there was not one of them left.

verses.firstHalf: Then they believed his words
verses.secondHalf: and sang praises unto him.

verses.firstHalf: But soon they forgot his works
verses.secondHalf: and would not wait for his counsel.

verses.firstHalf: A craving came upon them in the wilderness,
verses.secondHalf: and they tempted God in the desert.

verses.firstHalf: So he gave them their desire,
verses.secondHalf: and sent leanness into their soul.

verses.firstHalf: They were envious of Moses also in the camp,
verses.secondHalf: and of Aaron the holy one of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: So the earth opened and swallowed up Dathan
verses.secondHalf: and covered the company of Abiram,

verses.firstHalf: And fire was kindled in their company;
verses.secondHalf: the flame burnt up the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: They made a calf in Horeb
verses.secondHalf: and worshiped a molten image.

verses.firstHalf: Thus they exchanged their glory
verses.secondHalf: for the image of a calf that feeds on hay.

verses.firstHalf: And they forgot God their Savior,
verses.secondHalf: who had done great things in Egypt,

verses.firstHalf: Wondrous works in the land of Ham,
verses.secondHalf: and fearful things by the Red Sea.

verses.firstHalf: So he said he would have destroyed them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the gap
verses.secondHalf: to turn away his wrathful indignation, lest he should destroy them.

verses.firstHalf: Then they scorned that pleasant land
verses.secondHalf: and gave no credence to his word,

verses.firstHalf: But murmured in their tents
verses.secondHalf: and did not hearken to the voice of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Then he lifted up his hand against them
verses.secondHalf: to overthrow them in the wilderness,

verses.firstHalf: To cast out their seed among the nations,
verses.secondHalf: and to scatter them in all the lands.

verses.firstHalf: They joined themselves to Baal-Peor
verses.secondHalf: and ate the offerings to the dead.

verses.firstHalf: Thus they provoked him to anger with their wanton deeds,
verses.secondHalf: and the plague broke out among them.

verses.firstHalf: Then Phineas stood up and interceded,
verses.secondHalf: and so the plague was ended;

verses.firstHalf: And that was counted to him as righteousness
verses.secondHalf: among all generations for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: They angered him also at the waters of strife,
verses.secondHalf: so that he punished Moses for their misdeeds;

verses.firstHalf: For they provoked him to anger,
verses.secondHalf: so that he spoke rashly with his lips.

verses.firstHalf: Neither did they destroy the peoples
verses.secondHalf: as the LORD commanded them,

verses.firstHalf: But intermingled among the nations
verses.secondHalf: and learned their heathen ways,

verses.firstHalf: So that they worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them;
verses.secondHalf: they offered their sons and their daughters to demons,

verses.firstHalf: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters,
verses.secondHalf: whom they offered to the idols of Canaan; and the land was defiled with blood.

verses.firstHalf: Thus were they defiled by their own works
verses.secondHalf: and went whoring with their own deeds.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people,
verses.secondHalf: and he abhorred his own inheritance,

verses.firstHalf: And he gave them over into the hands of the nations,
verses.secondHalf: and those who hated them were lords over them.

verses.firstHalf: Their enemies oppressed them
verses.secondHalf: and held them in subjection.

verses.firstHalf: Many a time did he deliver them,
verses.secondHalf: but they rebelled against him through their own devices, and were brought down in their wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Nevertheless, when he saw their adversity,
verses.secondHalf: when he heard their lamentation,

verses.firstHalf: He remembered his covenant and pitied them, according to the multitude of his mercies;
verses.secondHalf: he made all those who led them away captive to pity them.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the nations,
verses.secondHalf: that we may give thanks to your holy Name and make our boast of your praise.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting and world without end,
verses.secondHalf: and let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.secondHalf: and his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Let those whom the LORD has redeemed give thanks,
verses.secondHalf: whom he has delivered from the hand of the enemy,

verses.firstHalf: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west,
verses.secondHalf: from the north and from the south.

verses.firstHalf: They went astray in the wilderness, even in the desert,
verses.secondHalf: and found no city to dwell in;

verses.firstHalf: They were hungry and thirsty,
verses.secondHalf: and their soul fainted within them.

verses.firstHalf: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and he delivered them from their distress.

verses.firstHalf: He led them forth by a straight path
verses.secondHalf: until they came to a city where they might dwell.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.secondHalf: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.firstHalf: For he satisfies the empty soul
verses.secondHalf: and fills the hungry soul with goodness.

verses.firstHalf: Some sat in darkness, and in the shadow of death,
verses.secondHalf: being bound fast in misery and iron,

verses.firstHalf: Because they rebelled against the words of God
verses.secondHalf: and lightly regarded the counsel of the Most High.

verses.firstHalf: He also brought down their heart with heaviness;
verses.secondHalf: they fell down, and there was none to help them.

verses.firstHalf: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.firstHalf: For he brought them out of darkness, and out of the shadow of death,
verses.secondHalf: and broke their bonds asunder.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.secondHalf: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.firstHalf: For he has broken the gates of brass
verses.secondHalf: and shattered the bars of iron asunder.

verses.firstHalf: The foolish were plagued for their offense
verses.secondHalf: and because of their wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Their soul abhorred all manner of food,
verses.secondHalf: and they were even close to death’s door.

verses.firstHalf: So when they cried unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.secondHalf: he delivered them out of their distress.

verses.firstHalf: He sent his word and healed them,
verses.secondHalf: and they were saved from destruction.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.secondHalf: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!
