verses.firstHalf: That they would offer unto him the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.secondHalf: and tell of his works with gladness!

verses.firstHalf: Those who go down to the sea in ships,
verses.secondHalf: who carry out their business in great waters,

verses.firstHalf: They behold the works of the LORD
verses.secondHalf: and his wonders in the deep.

verses.firstHalf: For at his word the stormy wind arises,
verses.secondHalf: which lifts up the waves.

verses.firstHalf: They are carried up to heaven and down again to the deep;
verses.secondHalf: their soul melts away because of the trouble.

verses.firstHalf: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man,
verses.secondHalf: and are at their wits’ end.

verses.firstHalf: So when they cry unto the LORD in their trouble,
verses.secondHalf: he delivers them out of their distress.

verses.firstHalf: For he makes the storm to cease,
verses.secondHalf: so that the waves are still.

verses.firstHalf: Then they are glad, because they are at rest,
verses.secondHalf: and so he brings them into the haven where they desire to be.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that they would therefore praise the LORD for his goodness
verses.secondHalf: and declare the wonders that he does for the children of men!

verses.firstHalf: That they would exalt him also in the congregation of the people
verses.secondHalf: and praise him in the seat of the elders!

verses.firstHalf: He turns rivers into a wilderness
verses.secondHalf: and water-springs into thirsty ground,

verses.firstHalf: A fruitful land he makes barren,
verses.secondHalf: because of the wickedness of those who dwell there.

verses.firstHalf: Again, he makes the wilderness into pools of water
verses.secondHalf: and dry ground into water-springs;

verses.firstHalf: And there he sets the hungry
verses.secondHalf: that they may build a city to dwell in,

verses.firstHalf: That they may sow their land and plant vineyards
verses.secondHalf: to yield the fruits of increase.

verses.firstHalf: He blesses them, so that they multiply exceedingly,
verses.secondHalf: and does not allow their cattle to decrease.

verses.firstHalf: And again, when they are diminished and brought low,
verses.secondHalf: through oppression, through any plague or trouble,

verses.firstHalf: Though he pours contempt on princes
verses.secondHalf: and lets them wander in the pathless wilderness,

verses.firstHalf: Yet he helps the poor out of misery
verses.secondHalf: and increases their households like a flock of sheep.

verses.firstHalf: The righteous will consider this and rejoice,
verses.secondHalf: and the mouth of all wickedness shall be stopped.

verses.firstHalf: Whoever is wise will ponder these things,
verses.secondHalf: and shall understand the loving-kindness of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: O God, my heart is fixed, my heart is firmly fixed;
verses.secondHalf: I will sing and give praise with the best that I have.

verses.firstHalf: Awake, my soul; awake, lute and harp;
verses.secondHalf: I myself will awaken the dawn.

verses.firstHalf: I will give thanks unto you, O LORD, among the peoples,
verses.secondHalf: and I will sing praises unto you among the nations,

verses.firstHalf: For the greatness of your mercy reaches to the heavens,
verses.secondHalf: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

verses.firstHalf: Exalt yourself, O God, above the heavens;
verses.secondHalf: let your glory be over all the earth.

verses.firstHalf: That your beloved may be delivered,
verses.secondHalf: save me by your right hand, and answer me.

verses.firstHalf: God has spoken in his holiness:
verses.secondHalf: “I will rejoice and divide Shechem, and parcel out the valley of Succoth.

verses.firstHalf: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine;
verses.secondHalf: Ephraim also is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

verses.firstHalf: Moab is my wash-pot; over Edom will I cast my shoe;
verses.secondHalf: over Philistia will I triumph.”

verses.firstHalf: Who will lead me into the strong city,
verses.secondHalf: and who will bring me into Edom?

verses.firstHalf: Have you not forsaken us, O God?
verses.secondHalf: And will you not, O God, go forth with our hosts?

verses.firstHalf: O help us against the enemy,
verses.secondHalf: for vain is the help of man.

verses.firstHalf: Through God we shall do great acts,
verses.secondHalf: for it is he who shall tread down our enemies.

verses.firstHalf: Hold not your tongue, O God of my praise,
verses.secondHalf: for the mouth of the ungodly, the mouth of the deceitful is opened upon me.

verses.firstHalf: They have spoken against me with false tongues;
verses.secondHalf: they encompassed me with words of hatred, and fought against me without a cause.

verses.firstHalf: In return for the love that I had for them, they have become my adversaries;
verses.secondHalf: but I give myself to prayer.

verses.firstHalf: Thus have they rewarded me evil for good,
verses.secondHalf: and hatred for my love.

verses.firstHalf: Set an ungodly man to be ruler over him,
verses.secondHalf: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.

verses.firstHalf: When judgment is given, let him be condemned,
verses.secondHalf: and let sentence be passed on him for guilt.

verses.firstHalf: Let his days be few,
verses.secondHalf: and let another take his office.

verses.firstHalf: Let his children be fatherless
verses.secondHalf: and his wife a widow.

verses.firstHalf: Let his children be vagabonds and beg their bread;
verses.secondHalf: let them be driven out, even from desolate places.

verses.firstHalf: Let the creditor consume all that he has,
verses.secondHalf: and let strangers take his labor for spoil.

verses.firstHalf: Let there be no one to pity him,
verses.secondHalf: nor to have compassion upon his fatherless children.

verses.firstHalf: Let his posterity be destroyed,
verses.secondHalf: and in the next generation let his name be blotted out.

verses.firstHalf: Let the wickedness of his fathers be held in remembrance in the sight of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.firstHalf: Let them be always before the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: that he may root out the memorial of them from the earth,

verses.firstHalf: Because he was not minded to do good,
verses.secondHalf: but persecuted to death the poor and needy, and those who were brokenhearted.

verses.firstHalf: His delight was in cursing; let curses come upon him;
verses.secondHalf: he loved not blessing; therefore let it be far from him.

verses.firstHalf: He clothed himself with cursing as with a garment,
verses.secondHalf: so let it soak into his body like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.firstHalf: Let it be to him as the cloak that he has on
verses.secondHalf: and as the belt that he always wears.

verses.firstHalf: Let this be the recompense from the LORD to my enemies,
verses.secondHalf: and to those who speak evil against my soul.

verses.firstHalf: But deal with me, O LORD God, according to your Name;
verses.secondHalf: for sweet is your mercy.

verses.firstHalf: O deliver me, for I am helpless and poor,
verses.secondHalf: and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.firstHalf: I disappear like the shadow that lengthens,
verses.secondHalf: and am shaken off like a grasshopper.

verses.firstHalf: My knees are weak through fasting;
verses.secondHalf: my flesh is grown lean for want of nourishment.

verses.firstHalf: I have become a reproach to them;
verses.secondHalf: when they look on me, they shake their heads.

verses.firstHalf: Help me, O LORD my God;
verses.secondHalf: save me according to your mercy;

verses.firstHalf: And they shall know that this is your hand,
verses.secondHalf: and that you, O LORD, have done it.

verses.firstHalf: Though they curse, yet you bless;
verses.secondHalf: let them be confounded who rise up against me, but let your servant rejoice.

verses.firstHalf: Let my adversaries be clothed with shame,
verses.secondHalf: and let them cover themselves with their own disgrace as with a cloak.

verses.firstHalf: As for me, I will give great thanks unto the LORD with my mouth,
verses.secondHalf: and praise him among the multitude,

verses.firstHalf: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor,
verses.secondHalf: to save their souls from the unrighteous judges.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD said unto my Lord, “Sit at my right hand,
verses.secondHalf: until I make your enemies your footstool.”

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall send the scepter of your power out of Zion:
verses.secondHalf: “Rule in the midst of your enemies.”

verses.firstHalf: In the day of your power the people, in holy raiment, shall offer you freewill offerings;
verses.secondHalf: from the womb of the morning, the dew of your youth belongs to you.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has sworn and will not recant:
verses.secondHalf: “You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.”

verses.firstHalf: The Lord at your right hand
verses.secondHalf: shall smite kings in the day of his wrath.

verses.firstHalf: He shall judge the nations;
verses.secondHalf: he shall fill the lands with dead bodies, and strike down heads over many countries.

verses.firstHalf: He shall drink from the brook by the way;
verses.secondHalf: therefore shall he lift up his head.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD. I will give thanks unto the LORD with my whole heart,
verses.secondHalf: in the company of the upright, and among the congregation.

verses.firstHalf: The works of the LORD are great,
verses.secondHalf: sought out by all who have pleasure in them.

verses.firstHalf: His work is worthy to be praised and held in honor,
verses.secondHalf: and his righteousness endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: He has made his marvelous works to be had in remembrance;
verses.secondHalf: The LORD is gracious and merciful.

verses.firstHalf: He has given food to those who fear him;
verses.secondHalf: he shall ever be mindful of his covenant.

verses.firstHalf: He has shown his people the power of his works,
verses.secondHalf: that he may give them the heritage of the nations.

verses.firstHalf: The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice;
verses.secondHalf: all his commandments are true.

verses.firstHalf: They stand fast for ever and ever,
verses.secondHalf: and are done in truth and equity.

verses.firstHalf: He sent redemption to his people; he has commanded his covenant for ever;
verses.secondHalf: holy and awesome is his Name.

verses.firstHalf: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom;
verses.secondHalf: a good understanding have all those who live accordingly; his praise endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD! Blessed is the one who fears the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: who has great delight in his commandments.

verses.firstHalf: His seed shall be mighty in the land;
verses.secondHalf: the generation of the faithful shall be blessed.

verses.firstHalf: Riches and plenteousness shall be in his house,
verses.secondHalf: and his righteousness shall endure for ever.

verses.firstHalf: For the upright, there rises light in the darkness;
verses.secondHalf: he is merciful, loving, and righteous.

verses.firstHalf: It is good for him to be generous in lending
verses.secondHalf: and to guide his words with discretion.

verses.firstHalf: For he shall never be moved,
verses.secondHalf: and the righteous shall be kept in everlasting remembrance.

verses.firstHalf: He will not be afraid of any evil tidings,
verses.secondHalf: for his heart is steadfast and trusts in the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: His heart is established, and will not fear;
verses.secondHalf: at the last he shall see his desire upon his enemies.

verses.firstHalf: He has given freely to the poor,
verses.secondHalf: and his righteousness endures for ever; his horn shall be exalted with honor.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly shall see it, and shall be angry;
verses.secondHalf: he shall gnash his teeth, and waste away; the desire of the ungodly shall perish.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD. Sing praises, you servants of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: O praise the Name of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed be the Name of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD’s Name be praised
verses.secondHalf: from the rising up of the sun to the going down of the same.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is high above all nations,
verses.secondHalf: and his glory above the heavens.

verses.firstHalf: Who is like the LORD our God, who has his dwelling so high,
verses.secondHalf: and yet humbles himself to behold the things that are in heaven and earth?

verses.firstHalf: He takes up the lowly out of the dust,
verses.secondHalf: and lifts the poor out of the ashes,

verses.firstHalf: That he may set them with the princes,
verses.secondHalf: even with the princes of his people.

verses.firstHalf: He gives the barren woman a home to dwell in,
verses.secondHalf: and makes her to be a joyful mother of children. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: When Israel came out of Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: and the house of Jacob from among a people of a foreign tongue,

verses.firstHalf: Judah was God’s sanctuary,
verses.secondHalf: and Israel his dominion.

verses.firstHalf: The sea beheld it and fled;
verses.secondHalf: Jordan was driven back.

verses.firstHalf: The mountains skipped like rams,
verses.secondHalf: and the little hills like young sheep.

verses.firstHalf: What ailed you, O sea, that you fled?
verses.secondHalf: O Jordan, that you were driven back?

verses.firstHalf: You mountains, that you skipped like rams,
verses.secondHalf: and you little hills like young sheep?

verses.firstHalf: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
verses.secondHalf: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

verses.firstHalf: Who turned the hard rock into a pool of water,
verses.secondHalf: and the flint stone into a springing well.

verses.firstHalf: Not unto us, O LORD, not unto us, but unto your Name give the praise,
verses.secondHalf: for your loving mercy and for your truth’s sake.

verses.firstHalf: Why shall the nations say,
verses.secondHalf: “Where now is their God?”

verses.firstHalf: As for our God, he is in heaven;
verses.secondHalf: he has done whatsoever pleased him.

verses.firstHalf: Their idols are silver and gold,
verses.secondHalf: even the work of human hands.

verses.firstHalf: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.secondHalf: eyes have they, but they see not.

verses.firstHalf: They have ears, but they hear not;
verses.secondHalf: noses have they, but they smell not.

verses.firstHalf: They have hands, but they feel not; feet have they, but they walk not;
verses.secondHalf: neither is there any sound in their throat.

verses.firstHalf: Those who make them are like them,
verses.secondHalf: and so are all who put their trust in them.

verses.firstHalf: But you, O house of Israel, trust in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: he is their helper and defender.

verses.firstHalf: You house of Aaron, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: he is their helper and defender.

verses.firstHalf: You who fear the LORD, put your trust in the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: he is their helper and defender.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has been mindful of us, and he shall bless us;
verses.secondHalf: he shall bless the house of Israel; he shall bless the house of Aaron;

verses.firstHalf: He shall bless those who fear the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: both small and great together.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall increase you more and more,
verses.secondHalf: you and your children after you.

verses.firstHalf: You are the blessed of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: who has made heaven and earth.

verses.firstHalf: The heavens are the LORD’s;
verses.secondHalf: the earth has he given to the children of men.

verses.firstHalf: The dead praise you not, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: neither all those who go down into silence.

verses.firstHalf: But we will praise the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: from this time forth for evermore. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: I love the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: because he heard the voice of my prayer,

verses.firstHalf: Because he inclined his ear to me;
verses.secondHalf: therefore will I call upon him as long as I live.

verses.firstHalf: The snares of death encompassed me, and the pains of the Grave laid hold of me;
verses.secondHalf: I suffered trouble and sorrow.

verses.firstHalf: Then I called upon the Name of the LORD:
verses.secondHalf: “O LORD, I beseech you, deliver my soul.”

verses.firstHalf: Gracious is the LORD and righteous;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, our God is full of compassion.

verses.firstHalf: The Lord preserves the simple;
verses.secondHalf: I was in misery, and he helped me.

verses.firstHalf: Turn again to your rest, O my soul,
verses.secondHalf: for the LORD has rewarded you.

verses.firstHalf: You have delivered my soul from death,
verses.secondHalf: my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.

verses.firstHalf: I will walk before the LORD
verses.secondHalf: in the land of the living.

verses.firstHalf: I believed, and therefore will I speak: “I am greatly troubled.”
verses.secondHalf: I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”

verses.firstHalf: What shall I give unto the LORD
verses.secondHalf: for all the benefits that he has done unto me?

verses.firstHalf: I will lift up the cup of salvation
verses.secondHalf: and call upon the Name of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: I will pay my vows unto the Lord in the presence of all his people;
verses.secondHalf: dear in the sight of the LORD is the death of his saints.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, I am your servant;
verses.secondHalf: I am your servant, and the child of your handmaid; you have broken my bonds asunder.

verses.firstHalf: I will offer you the sacrifice of thanksgiving
verses.secondHalf: and will call upon the Name of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: I will pay my vows unto the LORD in the sight of all his people,
verses.secondHalf: in the courts of the LORD’s house, even in the midst of you, O Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD, all you nations;
verses.secondHalf: praise him, all you peoples.

verses.firstHalf: For great is his loving-kindness towards us,
verses.secondHalf: and the faithfulness of the LORD endures for ever. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious;
verses.secondHalf: his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Let Israel now confess that he is gracious,
verses.secondHalf: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Let the house of Aaron now confess
verses.secondHalf: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, let those who fear the LORD confess
verses.secondHalf: that his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: I called upon the LORD in trouble,
verses.secondHalf: and the LORD heard me and set me free.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is on my side;
verses.secondHalf: I will not fear what man can do to me.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD takes my side with those who help me;
verses.secondHalf: therefore shall I look in triumph on my enemies.

verses.firstHalf: It is better to trust in the LORD
verses.secondHalf: than to put any confidence in man.

verses.firstHalf: It is better to trust in the LORD
verses.secondHalf: than to put any confidence in princes.

verses.firstHalf: All the nations encompass me,
verses.secondHalf: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.

verses.firstHalf: They hem me in on every side; indeed, they hem me in on every side,
verses.secondHalf: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.

verses.firstHalf: They come about me like bees, and blaze like fire among the thorns,
verses.secondHalf: but in the Name of the LORD will I cut them off.

verses.firstHalf: I was thrust aside so that I almost fell,
verses.secondHalf: but the LORD was my help.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is my strength and my song,
verses.secondHalf: and has become my salvation.

verses.firstHalf: The voice of joy and deliverance is in the dwellings of the righteous;
verses.secondHalf: the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.

verses.firstHalf: The right hand of the LORD is exalted;
verses.secondHalf: the right hand of the LORD brings mighty things to pass.

verses.firstHalf: I shall not die, but live,
verses.secondHalf: and declare the works of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has chastened and corrected me,
verses.secondHalf: but he has not given me over to death.

verses.firstHalf: Open unto me the gates of righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: that I may go into them, and give thanks unto the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: This is the gate of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: the righteous shall enter into it.

verses.firstHalf: I will thank you, for you have heard me,
verses.secondHalf: and have become my salvation.

verses.firstHalf: The same stone which the builders refused
verses.secondHalf: has become the chief cornerstone.

verses.firstHalf: This is the LORD’s doing,
verses.secondHalf: and it is marvelous in our eyes.

verses.firstHalf: This is the day that the LORD has made;
verses.secondHalf: we will rejoice and be glad in it.

verses.firstHalf: Help me now, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: O LORD, send us now prosperity.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is he who comes in the Name of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: we bless you from the house of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: God is the LORD, who has shown us light;
verses.secondHalf: bind the sacrifice with cords, even to the horns of the altar.

verses.firstHalf: You are my God, and I will thank you;
verses.secondHalf: you are my God, and I will exalt you.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious;
verses.secondHalf: his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are those who are undefiled in their ways,
verses.secondHalf: and walk in the law of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies
verses.secondHalf: and seek him with their whole heart,

verses.firstHalf: Even those who do no wickedness
verses.secondHalf: and perfectly walk in his ways.

verses.firstHalf: You have ordered your precepts
verses.secondHalf: that we should diligently keep them.

verses.firstHalf: O that my ways were made so direct
verses.secondHalf: that I might keep your statutes!

verses.firstHalf: Then would I not be put to shame
verses.secondHalf: while I give heed unto all your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: I will thank you with an upright heart,
verses.secondHalf: when I have learned your righteous judgments.

verses.firstHalf: I will keep your statutes;
verses.secondHalf: O do not forsake me utterly. Beth

verses.firstHalf: How shall a young man cleanse his way?
verses.secondHalf: By ruling himself according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: With my whole heart I have sought you;
verses.secondHalf: O let me not go astray from your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Your words have I hidden within my heart,
verses.secondHalf: that I may not sin against you.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are you, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: teach me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: With my lips have I been telling
verses.secondHalf: of all the judgments of your mouth.

verses.firstHalf: I have had greater delight in the way of your testimonies
verses.secondHalf: than in all manner of riches.

verses.firstHalf: I will meditate on your commandments
verses.secondHalf: and have respect for all your ways.

verses.firstHalf: My delight will be in your statutes,
verses.secondHalf: and I will not forget your word. Gimel

verses.firstHalf: O do well unto your servant,
verses.secondHalf: that I may live, and keep your word.

verses.firstHalf: Open my eyes that I may see
verses.secondHalf: the wondrous things of your law.

verses.firstHalf: I am a sojourner on earth;
verses.secondHalf: O hide not your commandments from me.

verses.firstHalf: My soul is consumed with the fervent desire
verses.secondHalf: that it always has for your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: You have rebuked the proud,
verses.secondHalf: and cursed are those who stray from your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: O turn from me shame and contempt,
verses.secondHalf: for I have kept your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: Though princes sit and speak against me,
verses.secondHalf: yet will your servant meditate on your statutes;

verses.firstHalf: For your testimonies are my delight,
verses.secondHalf: and they are my counselors. Daleth

verses.firstHalf: My soul cleaves to the dust;
verses.secondHalf: O revive me, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: I have acknowledged my ways, and you heard me;
verses.secondHalf: O teach me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: Make me to understand the way of your commandments,
verses.secondHalf: and so shall I meditate on your wondrous works.

verses.firstHalf: My soul melts away for heaviness;
verses.secondHalf: comfort me according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: Take from me the way of lying,
verses.secondHalf: and graciously teach me your law.

verses.firstHalf: I have chosen the way of truth,
verses.secondHalf: and your judgments have I set before me.

verses.firstHalf: I hold fast to your testimonies;
verses.secondHalf: O LORD, let me not be put to shame.

verses.firstHalf: I will run the way of your commandments
verses.secondHalf: when you enlarge my heart with understanding. He

verses.firstHalf: Teach me, O LORD, the way of your statutes,
verses.secondHalf: and I shall keep it to the end.

verses.firstHalf: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, I shall keep it with my whole heart.

verses.firstHalf: Make me go in the path of your commandments,
verses.secondHalf: for therein is my desire.

verses.firstHalf: Incline my heart to your testimonies,
verses.secondHalf: and not to covetous desires.

verses.firstHalf: O turn away my eyes, lest they behold vanity,
verses.secondHalf: and revive me in your ways.

verses.firstHalf: Confirm your word to your servant,
verses.secondHalf: and to all those who fear you.

verses.firstHalf: Take away the reproach that I am afraid of,
verses.secondHalf: for your judgments are good.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, my delight is in your precepts;
verses.secondHalf: O revive me in your righteousness. Waw

verses.firstHalf: Let your loving mercy come to me, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: even your salvation, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: So shall I answer those who taunt me,
verses.secondHalf: for my trust is in your word.

verses.firstHalf: O do not take the word of your truth utterly out of my mouth,
verses.secondHalf: for my hope is in your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: So shall I always keep your law,
verses.secondHalf: even for ever and ever;

verses.firstHalf: And I will walk at liberty,
verses.secondHalf: for I seek your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: I will speak of your testimonies also, even before kings,
verses.secondHalf: and will not be ashamed;

verses.firstHalf: And my delight shall be in your commandments,
verses.secondHalf: which I have loved exceedingly.

verses.firstHalf: My hands also will I lift up to your commandments,
verses.secondHalf: and I will meditate on your statutes. Zayin

verses.firstHalf: O remember your word to your servant,
verses.secondHalf: in which you have caused me to put my trust.

verses.firstHalf: This is my comfort in my trouble,
verses.secondHalf: for your word has given me life.

verses.firstHalf: The proud have held me exceedingly in derision,
verses.secondHalf: yet I have not turned aside from your law.

verses.firstHalf: For I have remembered, O LORD, your judgments from of old,
verses.secondHalf: and by them I have received comfort.

verses.firstHalf: I am filled with indignation,
verses.secondHalf: because of the ungodly who forsake your law.

verses.firstHalf: Your statutes have been my songs
verses.secondHalf: in the house of my pilgrimage.

verses.firstHalf: I have thought upon your Name, O LORD, in the night season,
verses.secondHalf: and I have kept your law.

verses.firstHalf: This has been my reward,
verses.secondHalf: because I have kept your commandments. Heth

verses.firstHalf: You are my portion, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: I have promised to keep your law.

verses.firstHalf: I made my humble petition in your presence with my whole heart;
verses.secondHalf: O be merciful to me, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: I have called my ways to remembrance
verses.secondHalf: and turned my feet to your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: I made haste and did not delay
verses.secondHalf: to keep your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: The cords of the ungodly have encircled me,
verses.secondHalf: but I have not forgotten your law.

verses.firstHalf: At midnight I will rise to give thanks to you,
verses.secondHalf: because of your righteous judgments.

verses.firstHalf: I am a companion of all those who fear you
verses.secondHalf: and keep your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: The earth, O LORD, is full of your mercy;
verses.secondHalf: O teach me your statutes. Teth

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, you have dealt graciously with your servant,
verses.secondHalf: according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: O teach me true understanding and knowledge,
verses.secondHalf: for I have believed your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Before I was afflicted I went astray,
verses.secondHalf: but now I keep your word.

verses.firstHalf: You are good and gracious;
verses.secondHalf: O teach me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: The proud have slandered me with lies,
verses.secondHalf: but I will keep your commandments with my whole heart.

verses.firstHalf: Their heart has become gross with fatness,
verses.secondHalf: but my delight is in your law.

verses.firstHalf: It is good for me that I have been afflicted,
verses.secondHalf: that I may learn your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: The law of your mouth is dearer to me
verses.secondHalf: than thousands in gold and silver. Yodh

verses.firstHalf: Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
verses.secondHalf: O give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Those who fear you will be glad when they see me,
verses.secondHalf: because I have put my trust in your word.

verses.firstHalf: I know, O Lord, that your judgments are right,
verses.secondHalf: and that in your faithfulness you have caused me to be afflicted.

verses.firstHalf: O let your merciful kindness be my comfort,
verses.secondHalf: according to your word to your servant.

verses.firstHalf: O let your loving mercies come to me, that I may live,
verses.secondHalf: for your law is my delight.

verses.firstHalf: Let the proud be put to shame, for they go about wickedly to destroy me;
verses.secondHalf: but I will meditate on your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Let those who fear you turn to me,
verses.secondHalf: even those who know your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: O let my heart be sound in your statutes,
verses.secondHalf: that I may never be put to shame. Kaph

verses.firstHalf: My soul has longed for your salvation,
verses.secondHalf: and I have a good hope because of your word.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes long sorely for your word,
verses.secondHalf: saying, “O when will you comfort me?”

verses.firstHalf: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
verses.secondHalf: yet I do not forget your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: How many are the days of your servant?
verses.secondHalf: When will you execute judgment on those who persecute me?

verses.firstHalf: The proud have dug pits for me;
verses.secondHalf: they do not walk after your law.

verses.firstHalf: All your commandments are true.
verses.secondHalf: They persecute me falsely; O Lord, be my help.

verses.firstHalf: They had almost made an end of me on earth,
verses.secondHalf: but I have not forsaken your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: O revive me with your loving-kindness,
verses.secondHalf: and so shall I keep the testimonies of your mouth. Lamedh

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, your word endures for ever;
verses.secondHalf: it stands fast in heaven.

verses.firstHalf: Your faithfulness remains from one generation to another;
verses.secondHalf: you have laid the foundation of the earth, and it abides.

verses.firstHalf: Surely your ordinances stand firm this day,
verses.secondHalf: for all things are your servants.

verses.firstHalf: If my delight had not been in your law,
verses.secondHalf: I should have perished in my affliction.

verses.firstHalf: I will never forget your commandments,
verses.secondHalf: for with them you have enlivened me.

verses.firstHalf: I am yours; O save me!
verses.secondHalf: For I have sought your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly lie in wait for me to destroy me,
verses.secondHalf: but I will consider your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: I see that all things come to an end,
verses.secondHalf: but your commandment has no bounds. Mem

verses.firstHalf: Lord, what love I have for your law;
verses.secondHalf: all the day long I meditate on it.

verses.firstHalf: You, through your commandment, have made me wiser than my enemies,
verses.secondHalf: for it is always with me.

verses.firstHalf: I have more understanding than my teachers,
verses.secondHalf: for your testimonies are my study.

verses.firstHalf: I am wiser than the agéd,
verses.secondHalf: because I keep your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
verses.secondHalf: that I may keep your word.

verses.firstHalf: I have not turned aside from your judgments,
verses.secondHalf: for you yourself have taught me.

verses.firstHalf: Oh how sweet are your words to my taste;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, sweeter than honey to my mouth.

verses.firstHalf: Through your commandments I get understanding;
verses.secondHalf: therefore I hate all evil ways. Nun

verses.firstHalf: Your word is a lantern to my feet
verses.secondHalf: and a light upon my path.

verses.firstHalf: I have sworn and am steadfastly purposed
verses.secondHalf: to keep your righteous judgments.

verses.firstHalf: I am troubled above measure;
verses.secondHalf: revive me, O LORD, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: Let the freewill offerings of my mouth please you, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: and teach me your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: My life is always in my hand,
verses.secondHalf: yet I do not forget your law.

verses.firstHalf: The ungodly have laid a snare for me,
verses.secondHalf: yet I have not strayed from your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Your testimonies have I claimed as my heritage for ever,
verses.secondHalf: and why? They are the very joy of my heart.

verses.firstHalf: I have applied my heart to fulfill your statutes always,
verses.secondHalf: even unto the end. Samekh

verses.firstHalf: I hate those who are double-minded,
verses.secondHalf: but your law do I love.

verses.firstHalf: You are my defense and shield,
verses.secondHalf: and my trust is in your word.

verses.firstHalf: Away from me, you wicked.
verses.secondHalf: I will keep the commandments of my God.

verses.firstHalf: Establish me according to your word, that I may live,
verses.secondHalf: and let me not be disappointed in my hope.

verses.firstHalf: Hold me up, and I shall be safe;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, my delight shall be ever in your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: You have trodden down all those who depart from your statutes,
verses.secondHalf: for they only imagine deceit.

verses.firstHalf: You put away all the ungodly of the earth like dross;
verses.secondHalf: therefore I love your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: My flesh trembles for fear of you,
verses.secondHalf: and I am afraid of your judgments. Ayin

verses.firstHalf: I have done that which is lawful and right;
verses.secondHalf: O give me not over to my oppressors.

verses.firstHalf: Be surety for your servant’s good;
verses.secondHalf: O let not the arrogant oppress me.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes have wasted away with looking for your salvation,
verses.secondHalf: and for the word of your righteousness.

verses.firstHalf: O deal with your servant according to your loving mercy,
verses.secondHalf: and teach me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: I am your servant; O grant me understanding,
verses.secondHalf: that I may know your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: It is time for you, O LORD, to act,
verses.secondHalf: for they have broken your law.

verses.firstHalf: For I love your commandments above all things,
verses.secondHalf: more than gold and precious stones.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore I hold all your commandments to be right,
verses.secondHalf: and all false ways I utterly abhor. Pe

verses.firstHalf: Your testimonies are wonderful;
verses.secondHalf: therefore does my soul keep them.

verses.firstHalf: When your word goes forth it gives light
verses.secondHalf: and understanding to the simple.

verses.firstHalf: I opened my mouth, and drew in my breath,
verses.secondHalf: for my delight was in your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: O look upon me, and be merciful unto me,
verses.secondHalf: as you always do for those who love your Name.

verses.firstHalf: Order my steps according to your word,
verses.secondHalf: and so shall no wickedness have dominion over me.

verses.firstHalf: O deliver me from those who deal wrongfully,
verses.secondHalf: and so shall I keep your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Show the light of your countenance upon your servant,
verses.secondHalf: and teach me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes gush out water
verses.secondHalf: because of those who do not keep your law. Sadhe

verses.firstHalf: Righteous are you, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and true are your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: The testimonies that you have commanded
verses.secondHalf: are exceedingly righteous and true.

verses.firstHalf: My zeal has even consumed me,
verses.secondHalf: because my enemies have forgotten your words.

verses.firstHalf: Your word is tested to the uttermost,
verses.secondHalf: and therefore your servant loves it.

verses.firstHalf: I am small, and of no reputation,
verses.secondHalf: yet I do not forget your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and your law is the truth.

verses.firstHalf: Trouble and heaviness have taken hold of me,
verses.secondHalf: yet my delight is in your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: The righteousness of your testimonies is everlasting;
verses.secondHalf: O grant me understanding, and I shall live. Qoph

verses.firstHalf: I call with my whole heart.
verses.secondHalf: Hear me, O LORD; I will keep your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: Even unto you do I call;
verses.secondHalf: help me, and I shall keep your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: Early in the morning do I cry unto you,
verses.secondHalf: for in your word is my trust.

verses.firstHalf: My eyes open before the night watches,
verses.secondHalf: that I may meditate on your words.

verses.firstHalf: Hear my voice, O LORD, according to your loving-kindness;
verses.secondHalf: give me life according to your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: They draw nigh who in malice persecute me,
verses.secondHalf: and are far from your law.

verses.firstHalf: Be near at hand, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for all your commandments are true.

verses.firstHalf: Concerning your testimonies, I have known long ago
verses.secondHalf: that you have founded them for ever. Resh

verses.firstHalf: O consider my adversity and deliver me,
verses.secondHalf: for I do not forget your law.

verses.firstHalf: Plead my cause and deliver me;
verses.secondHalf: give me life according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: Salvation is far from the ungodly,
verses.secondHalf: for they do not regard your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: Great is your mercy, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: give me life according to your judgments.

verses.firstHalf: Many there are who trouble me and persecute me,
verses.secondHalf: yet I do not swerve from your testimonies.

verses.firstHalf: It grieves me when I see the transgressors,
verses.secondHalf: because they do not keep your law.

verses.firstHalf: Consider, O LORD, how I love your commandments;
verses.secondHalf: O give me life according to your loving-kindness.

verses.firstHalf: Your word is true from everlasting;
verses.secondHalf: all the judgments of your righteousness endure for evermore. Shin

verses.firstHalf: Princes have persecuted me without a cause,
verses.secondHalf: but my heart stands in awe of your word.

verses.firstHalf: I am as glad of your word
verses.secondHalf: as one who finds great spoils.

verses.firstHalf: As for lies, I hate and abhor them,
verses.secondHalf: but your law do I love.

verses.firstHalf: Seven times a day do I praise you,
verses.secondHalf: because of your righteous judgments.

verses.firstHalf: Great is the peace they have who love your law
verses.secondHalf: and find in it no stumbling block.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, I have looked for your saving health
verses.secondHalf: and have done your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: My soul has kept your testimonies,
verses.secondHalf: and I have loved them exceedingly.

verses.firstHalf: I have kept your commandments and testimonies,
verses.secondHalf: for all my ways are before you. Taw

verses.firstHalf: Let my complaint come before you, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: give me understanding, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: Let my supplication come before you;
verses.secondHalf: deliver me, according to your word.

verses.firstHalf: My lips shall pour forth your praise,
verses.secondHalf: when you have taught me your statutes.

verses.firstHalf: Surely my tongue shall sing of your word,
verses.secondHalf: for all your commandments are righteous.

verses.firstHalf: Let your hand be strong to help me,
verses.secondHalf: for I have chosen your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: I have longed for your saving health, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and in your law is my delight.

verses.firstHalf: O let my soul live, and it shall praise you;
verses.secondHalf: and let your judgments help me.

verses.firstHalf: I have gone astray like a sheep that is lost;
verses.secondHalf: O seek your servant, for I do not forget your commandments.

verses.firstHalf: When I was in trouble I called upon the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and he hearkened to my calling.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips
verses.secondHalf: and from a deceitful tongue.

verses.firstHalf: What reward shall be given or done unto you, O false tongue?
verses.secondHalf: Even mighty and sharp arrows, with hot burning coals.

verses.firstHalf: Woe is me, that I am constrained to dwell in Meshech,
verses.secondHalf: and to have my habitation among the tents of Kedar.

verses.firstHalf: My soul has long dwelt among those
verses.secondHalf: who are enemies of peace.

verses.firstHalf: I labor for peace, but when I speak to them of it,
verses.secondHalf: they make themselves ready for battle.

verses.firstHalf: I will lift up my eyes unto the hills;
verses.secondHalf: from whence comes my help?

verses.firstHalf: My help comes from the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: who has made heaven and earth.

verses.firstHalf: He will not let your foot be moved,
verses.secondHalf: and he who keeps you will not sleep.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, he who keeps Israel
verses.secondHalf: shall neither slumber nor sleep.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD himself is your keeper;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD is your defense upon your right hand,

verses.firstHalf: So that the sun shall not burn you by day,
verses.secondHalf: neither the moon by night.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall preserve you from all evil;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, it is he who shall keep your soul.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall preserve your going out and your coming in,
verses.secondHalf: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: I was glad when they said unto me,
verses.secondHalf: “We will go into the house of the LORD.”

verses.firstHalf: Now our feet are standing
verses.secondHalf: within your gates, O Jerusalem.

verses.firstHalf: Jerusalem is built as a city
verses.secondHalf: that is at unity in itself.

verses.firstHalf: For there the tribes go up, even the tribes of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks unto the Name of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: For there is the throne of judgment,
verses.secondHalf: even the throne of the house of David.

verses.firstHalf: O pray for the peace of Jerusalem;
verses.secondHalf: they shall prosper that love you.

verses.firstHalf: Peace be within your walls
verses.secondHalf: and plenteousness within your palaces.

verses.firstHalf: For my brethren and companions’ sakes,
verses.secondHalf: I will wish you prosperity.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, because of the house of the LORD our God,
verses.secondHalf: I will seek to do you good.

verses.firstHalf: Unto you I lift up my eyes,
verses.secondHalf: you who are enthroned in the heavens.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their masters,
verses.secondHalf: and as the eyes of a maiden to the hand of her mistress,

verses.firstHalf: Even so our eyes wait upon the LORD our God,
verses.secondHalf: until he show us his favor.

verses.firstHalf: Have mercy upon us, O LORD, have mercy upon us,
verses.secondHalf: for we have suffered more than enough contempt.

verses.firstHalf: Long has our soul suffered the scorn of the wealthy
verses.secondHalf: and the spitefulness of the proud.

verses.firstHalf: If the LORD himself had not been on our side, now may Israel say:
verses.secondHalf: if the LORD himself had not been on our side, when men rose up against us,

verses.firstHalf: Then would they have swallowed us up alive,
verses.secondHalf: when they were so wrathfully displeased with us;

verses.firstHalf: Then the waters would have drowned us, and the torrent gone over us;
verses.secondHalf: then the raging waters would have gone clean over us.

verses.firstHalf: But praised be the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: who has not given us over to be prey for their teeth.

verses.firstHalf: We escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowler;
verses.secondHalf: the snare is broken, and we have been delivered.

verses.firstHalf: Our help is in the Name of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: the maker of heaven and earth.

verses.firstHalf: Those who put their trust in the LORD shall be like Mount Zion,
verses.secondHalf: which cannot be moved, but stands fast for ever.

verses.firstHalf: The hills stand about Jerusalem
verses.secondHalf: even as the LORD stands round about his people, from this time forth for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: For the scepter of the ungodly shall not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous,
verses.secondHalf: lest the righteous put forth their hand to do wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Do good, O LORD, unto those who are good,
verses.secondHalf: unto those who are good and true of heart.

verses.firstHalf: As for those who turn aside to their own wicked ways, the LORD shall lead them away with the evildoers;
verses.secondHalf: but peace shall be upon Israel.

verses.firstHalf: When the LORD overturned the captivity of Zion,
verses.secondHalf: then were we like those who dream.

verses.firstHalf: Then was our mouth filled with laughter
verses.secondHalf: and our tongue with shouts of joy.

verses.firstHalf: Then they said among the nations,
verses.secondHalf: “The LORD has done great things for them.”

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, the LORD has done great things for us already,
verses.secondHalf: whereof we rejoice.

verses.firstHalf: Overturn our captivity, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: as when streams refresh the deserts of the south.

verses.firstHalf: Those who sow in tears
verses.secondHalf: shall reap with songs of joy.

verses.firstHalf: He who goes on his way weeping and bears good seed
verses.secondHalf: shall doubtless come again with joy, and bring his sheaves with him.

verses.firstHalf: Unless the LORD builds the house,
verses.secondHalf: their labor is in vain who build it.

verses.firstHalf: Unless the LORD keeps the city,
verses.secondHalf: the watchman keeps vigil in vain.

verses.firstHalf: It is in vain that you rise up early, and take rest so late, and eat the bread of toil,
verses.secondHalf: for he gives to his beloved sleep.

verses.firstHalf: Behold, children are a heritage from the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and the fruit of the womb is a gift that comes from him.

verses.firstHalf: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
verses.secondHalf: so are the children of one’s youth.

verses.firstHalf: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them;
verses.secondHalf: he shall not be ashamed when he speaks with his enemies in the gate.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed are all those who fear the LORD
verses.secondHalf: and walk in his ways.

verses.firstHalf: For you shall eat of the labors of your hands;
verses.secondHalf: it shall be well with you, and happy you shall be.

verses.firstHalf: Your wife shall be as a fruitful vine
verses.secondHalf: upon the walls of your house,

verses.firstHalf: Your children like the olive branches
verses.secondHalf: round about your table.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, thus shall the man be blessed
verses.secondHalf: who fears the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: May the LORD bless you out of Zion;
verses.secondHalf: may you see Jerusalem in prosperity all your life long.

verses.firstHalf: May you see your children’s children,
verses.secondHalf: and may there be peace upon Israel.

verses.firstHalf: “Many a time have they fought against me from my youth on,”
verses.secondHalf: may Israel now say;

verses.firstHalf: “Indeed, many a time have they afflicted me from my youth on,
verses.secondHalf: but they have not prevailed against me.

verses.firstHalf: The plowers plowed upon my back,
verses.secondHalf: and made long furrows.

verses.firstHalf: But the righteous LORD
verses.secondHalf: has hewn the snares of the ungodly in pieces.”

verses.firstHalf: Let them be ashamed and turned backward,
verses.secondHalf: as many as hate Zion.

verses.firstHalf: Let them be as the grass growing upon the housetops,
verses.secondHalf: which withers before it grows up,

verses.firstHalf: Which does not fill the hand of the reaper,
verses.secondHalf: neither the bosom of him who binds up the sheaves,

verses.firstHalf: So that those who go by say not so much as, “The LORD prosper you.
verses.secondHalf: We bless you in the Name of the LORD.”

verses.firstHalf: Out of the deep have I called unto you, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: Lord, hear my voice.

verses.firstHalf: O let your ears consider well
verses.secondHalf: the voice of my supplications.

verses.firstHalf: If you, LORD, were to mark what is done amiss,
verses.secondHalf: O Lord, who could abide it?

verses.firstHalf: For there is mercy with you;
verses.secondHalf: therefore you shall be feared.

verses.firstHalf: I wait for the LORD; my soul waits for him;
verses.secondHalf: in his word is my trust.

verses.firstHalf: My soul waits for the Lord,
verses.secondHalf: more than watchmen for the morning, more than watchmen for the morning.

verses.firstHalf: O Israel, trust in the LORD, for with the LORD there is mercy,
verses.secondHalf: and with him is plenteous redemption;

verses.firstHalf: And he shall redeem Israel
verses.secondHalf: from all their sins.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, I am not haughty;
verses.secondHalf: I have no proud looks.

verses.firstHalf: I do not occupy myself with great matters,
verses.secondHalf: or with things that are too high for me.

verses.firstHalf: But I have stilled and quieted my soul, like a weaned child upon his mother’s breast;
verses.secondHalf: so is my soul quieted within me.

verses.firstHalf: O Israel, trust in the LORD
verses.secondHalf: from this time forth for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, remember David,
verses.secondHalf: and all his tribulations,

verses.firstHalf: How he swore unto the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and vowed a vow unto the Almighty God of Jacob:

verses.firstHalf: “I will not come within the tabernacle of my house,
verses.secondHalf: nor climb up into my bed,

verses.firstHalf: I will not allow my eyes to sleep, nor my eyelids to slumber,
verses.secondHalf: neither the temples of my head to take any rest,

verses.firstHalf: Until I find a place for the temple of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: a habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.”

verses.firstHalf: Lo, we heard of the ark at Ephrathah
verses.secondHalf: and found it in the wood.

verses.firstHalf: We will go into his tabernacle,
verses.secondHalf: and fall low on our knees before his footstool.

verses.firstHalf: Arise, O LORD, into your resting-place,
verses.secondHalf: you and the ark of your strength.

verses.firstHalf: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness,
verses.secondHalf: and let your saints sing with joy.

verses.firstHalf: For your servant David’s sake,
verses.secondHalf: turn not away the presence of your Anointed.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD has made a faithful oath unto David,
verses.secondHalf: and he shall not shrink from it:

verses.firstHalf: “Of the fruit of your body
verses.secondHalf: shall I set upon your throne.

verses.firstHalf: If your children will keep my covenant, and my testimonies that I shall teach them,
verses.secondHalf: their children also shall sit upon your throne for evermore.”

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD has chosen Zion for himself;
verses.secondHalf: he has longed for her to be his habitation:

verses.firstHalf: “This shall be my rest for ever;
verses.secondHalf: here will I dwell, for I have a delight therein.

verses.firstHalf: I will bless her provisions with increase,
verses.secondHalf: and will satisfy her poor with bread.

verses.firstHalf: I will clothe her priests with salvation,
verses.secondHalf: and her saints shall rejoice and sing.

verses.firstHalf: There shall I make the horn of David flourish;
verses.secondHalf: I have prepared a lantern for my Anointed.

verses.firstHalf: As for his enemies, I shall clothe them with shame;
verses.secondHalf: but upon his head shall his crown flourish.”

verses.firstHalf: Behold, how good and joyful a thing it is
verses.secondHalf: when brethren dwell together in unity.

verses.firstHalf: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard,
verses.secondHalf: even Aaron’s beard, and went down to the edges of his clothing,

verses.firstHalf: Like the dew of Hermon,
verses.secondHalf: which falls upon the hills of Zion.

verses.firstHalf: For there the LORD promised his blessing,
verses.secondHalf: even life for evermore.

verses.firstHalf: Behold now, praise the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: all you servants of the LORD,

verses.firstHalf: You that stand by night in the house of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: even in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.firstHalf: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
verses.secondHalf: and sing praises unto the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD who made heaven and earth
verses.secondHalf: give you blessing out of Zion.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD. Praise the Name of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: offer praise, you servants of the LORD,

verses.firstHalf: You who stand in the house of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: in the courts of the house of our God.

verses.firstHalf: O praise the LORD, for the LORD is good;
verses.secondHalf: sing praises unto his Name, for it is lovely.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD has chosen Jacob for himself
verses.secondHalf: and Israel for his own possession.

verses.firstHalf: For I know that the LORD is great,
verses.secondHalf: and that our Lord is above all gods.

verses.firstHalf: Whatsoever the LORD pleases he does, in heaven and on earth,
verses.secondHalf: in the seas and in all the deep places.

verses.firstHalf: He brings forth clouds from the ends of the earth
verses.secondHalf: and sends forth lightning with the rain, bringing the wind out of his treasuries.

verses.firstHalf: It was he who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: both of man and beast.

verses.firstHalf: He sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, O land of Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: against Pharaoh and all his servants.

verses.firstHalf: He smote many nations,
verses.secondHalf: and slew mighty kings:

verses.firstHalf: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og the king of Bashan,
verses.secondHalf: and all the kingdoms of Canaan.

verses.firstHalf: And he gave their land to be an inheritance,
verses.secondHalf: an inheritance for Israel his people.

verses.firstHalf: Your Name, O LORD, endures for ever;
verses.secondHalf: so does your renown, O LORD, from one generation to another.

verses.firstHalf: For the LORD will avenge his people
verses.secondHalf: and have compassion upon his servants.

verses.firstHalf: As for the idols of the nations, they are but silver and gold,
verses.secondHalf: the work of human hands.

verses.firstHalf: They have mouths, but they speak not;
verses.secondHalf: eyes have they, but they see not;

verses.firstHalf: They have ears, and yet they hear not,
verses.secondHalf: neither is there any breath in their mouths.

verses.firstHalf: Those who make them are like them,
verses.secondHalf: and so are all who put their trust in them.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O house of Israel;
verses.secondHalf: praise the LORD, O house of Aaron.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O house of Levi;
verses.secondHalf: you who fear the LORD, praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Praised be the LORD from Zion,
verses.secondHalf: who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is gracious,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the God of all gods,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the Lord of all lords,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who alone does great wonders,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who by his excellent wisdom made the heavens,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who laid out the earth above the waters,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who made the great lights,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: The sun to rule the day,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: The moon and the stars to govern the night,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And brought out Israel from among them,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: With a mighty hand and an outstretched arm,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who divided the Red Sea in two parts,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: But as for Pharaoh and his host, he overthrew them in the Red Sea,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who led his people through the wilderness,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who smote great kings,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And slew mighty kings,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: Sihon king of the Amorites,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And Og the king of Bashan,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And gave away their land for an inheritance,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: Even for an inheritance for Israel his servant,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who remembered us when we were in trouble,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever;

verses.firstHalf: And delivered us from our enemies,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: Who gives food to all flesh,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the God of heaven,
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: O give thanks unto the Lord of lords
verses.secondHalf: for his mercy endures for ever.

verses.firstHalf: By the waters of Babylon we sat down and wept,
verses.secondHalf: when we remembered you, O Zion.

verses.firstHalf: As for our harps, we hung them up
verses.secondHalf: upon the trees that are therein.

verses.firstHalf: For those who led us away captive required of us a song and melody in our heaviness:
verses.secondHalf: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

verses.firstHalf: How shall we sing the LORD’s song
verses.secondHalf: in the land of our captivity?

verses.firstHalf: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
verses.secondHalf: let my right hand forget its skill.

verses.firstHalf: If I do not remember you, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth,
verses.secondHalf: if I prefer not Jerusalem above my dearest joy.

verses.firstHalf: Remember the children of Edom, O LORD, in the day of Jerusalem,
verses.secondHalf: how they said, “Down with it, down with it, even to the ground.”

verses.firstHalf: O daughter of Babylon, wasted with misery,
verses.secondHalf: happy shall be the one who rewards you as you have done to us.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed shall he be who takes your children
verses.secondHalf: and throws them against the stones.

verses.firstHalf: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart;
verses.secondHalf: even before the gods will I sing praises to you.

verses.firstHalf: I will worship toward your holy temple and praise your Name, because of your loving-kindness and truth,
verses.secondHalf: for you have magnified your Name and your word above all things.

verses.firstHalf: When I called upon you, you heard me
verses.secondHalf: and gave me increase of strength.

verses.firstHalf: All the kings of the earth shall praise you, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: for they have heard the words of your mouth.

verses.firstHalf: They shall sing of the ways of the LORD,
verses.secondHalf: that great is the glory of the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: For though the LORD be high, yet he has respect for the lowly;
verses.secondHalf: as for the proud, he beholds them from afar.

verses.firstHalf: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, yet shall you refresh me;
verses.secondHalf: you shall stretch forth your hand upon the furiousness of my enemies, and your right hand shall save me.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall make good his loving-kindness toward me;
verses.secondHalf: your mercy, O LORD, endures for ever; despise not the works of your own hands.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, you have searched me out and known me;
verses.secondHalf: you know my sitting down and my rising up; you understand my thoughts from afar.

verses.firstHalf: You examine my path and my places of rest,
verses.secondHalf: and are acquainted with all my ways.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, there is not a word on my tongue,
verses.secondHalf: but you, O LORD, know it altogether.

verses.firstHalf: You have enclosed me behind and before,
verses.secondHalf: and have laid your hand upon me.

verses.firstHalf: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
verses.secondHalf: so excellent I cannot attain to it.

verses.firstHalf: Where shall I go then from your Spirit,
verses.secondHalf: or where shall I flee from your presence?

verses.firstHalf: If I climb up to heaven, you are there;
verses.secondHalf: if I make my bed in the Grave, you are there also.

verses.firstHalf: If I take the wings of the morning
verses.secondHalf: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,

verses.firstHalf: Even there shall your hand lead me,
verses.secondHalf: and your right hand shall hold me.

verses.firstHalf: If I say, “Surely the darkness shall cover me,”
verses.secondHalf: then shall my night be turned to day.

verses.firstHalf: Even the darkness is not dark to you, and the night is as clear as the day;
verses.secondHalf: the darkness and the light to you are both alike.

verses.firstHalf: For you yourself made my inmost parts;
verses.secondHalf: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

verses.firstHalf: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made;
verses.secondHalf: marvelous are your works, and my soul knows it very well.

verses.firstHalf: My bones were not hidden from you
verses.secondHalf: when I was made in secret and fashioned in the depths of the earth.

verses.firstHalf: Your eyes beheld my substance, while I was yet unformed;
verses.secondHalf: and in your book were all my members written,

verses.firstHalf: Which day by day were fashioned,
verses.secondHalf: when as yet there was none of them.

verses.firstHalf: How dear to me are your thoughts, O God.
verses.secondHalf: How great is the sum of them!

verses.firstHalf: If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand.
verses.secondHalf: When I wake up, I am present with you.

verses.firstHalf: Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God!
verses.secondHalf: Depart from me, you bloodthirsty men.

verses.firstHalf: For they speak unrighteously against you;
verses.secondHalf: your enemies take your Name in vain.

verses.firstHalf: Do I not hate those, O LORD, who hate you,
verses.secondHalf: and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, I hate them with a perfect hatred;
verses.secondHalf: they have become my own enemies.

verses.firstHalf: Search me, O God, and know my heart;
verses.secondHalf: try me and examine my thoughts.

verses.firstHalf: Look well if there be any way of wickedness in me,
verses.secondHalf: and lead me in the way everlasting.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver me, O LORD, from evildoers,
verses.secondHalf: and preserve me from the violent,

verses.firstHalf: Who imagine evil in their hearts
verses.secondHalf: and stir up strife all the day long.

verses.firstHalf: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent;
verses.secondHalf: adders’ poison is under their lips.

verses.firstHalf: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the ungodly;
verses.secondHalf: preserve me from the violent, who have purposed to overthrow my steps.

verses.firstHalf: The proud have laid a snare for me and spread out a net with cords;
verses.secondHalf: they have set traps in my way.

verses.firstHalf: I said unto the LORD, “You are my God;
verses.secondHalf: hear the voice of my prayers, O LORD.”

verses.firstHalf: O LORD God, the strength of my salvation,
verses.secondHalf: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

verses.firstHalf: Let not the ungodly have their desire, O LORD;
verses.secondHalf: let not their evil imagination prosper, lest they be too proud.

verses.firstHalf: Let not those who encompass me lift up their heads;
verses.secondHalf: let the evil of their own lips consume them.

verses.firstHalf: Let hot burning coals fall upon them;
verses.secondHalf: let them be cast into the fire and into the pit, that they may never rise up again.

verses.firstHalf: A slanderer shall not prosper upon the earth;
verses.secondHalf: evil shall hunt the wicked person to overthrow him.

verses.firstHalf: I am sure that the LORD will avenge the poor
verses.secondHalf: and maintain the cause of the helpless.

verses.firstHalf: Surely, the righteous shall give thanks unto your Name,
verses.secondHalf: and the just shall continue in your sight.

verses.firstHalf: LORD, I call upon you; hasten unto me,
verses.secondHalf: and hear my voice when I cry unto you.

verses.firstHalf: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense,
verses.secondHalf: and let the lifting up of my hands be an evening sacrifice.

verses.firstHalf: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth,
verses.secondHalf: and keep the door of my lips.

verses.firstHalf: O let not my heart be inclined to any evil thing;
verses.secondHalf: let me not be occupied in ungodly works with those who work wickedness, lest I eat of such things as please them.

verses.firstHalf: Rather, let the righteous smite me,
verses.secondHalf: and in their loving-kindness reprove me.

verses.firstHalf: But let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head;
verses.secondHalf: while I live, I will pray against their wickedness.

verses.firstHalf: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places,
verses.secondHalf: that they may hear my words, for they are sweet.

verses.firstHalf: Let their bones lie scattered at the mouth of the grave,
verses.secondHalf: as when the ploughman scatters the earth in furrows.

verses.firstHalf: But my eyes look unto you, O LORD God;
verses.secondHalf: in you is my refuge; O do not cast out my soul.

verses.firstHalf: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,
verses.secondHalf: and from the traps of the evildoers.

verses.firstHalf: Let the ungodly fall into their own nets together,
verses.secondHalf: and let me ever escape them.

verses.firstHalf: I cried unto the LORD with my voice;
verses.secondHalf: even unto the LORD I made my supplication.

verses.firstHalf: I poured out my complaints before him,
verses.secondHalf: and showed him my trouble.

verses.firstHalf: When my spirit was in heaviness, you knew my path;
verses.secondHalf: in the way wherein I walked they had secretly laid a snare for me.

verses.firstHalf: I looked also to my right hand
verses.secondHalf: and saw there was no one who would know me.

verses.firstHalf: I had no place to flee to,
verses.secondHalf: and no one cared for my soul.

verses.firstHalf: I cried out to you, O LORD, and said,
verses.secondHalf: “You are my refuge, and my portion in the land of the living.”

verses.firstHalf: Consider my complaint,
verses.secondHalf: for I am brought very low.

verses.firstHalf: O deliver me from my persecutors,
verses.secondHalf: for they are too strong for me.

verses.firstHalf: Bring me out of prison, that I may give thanks unto your Name.
verses.secondHalf: When you show me your loving-kindness, then shall the righteous gather around me.

verses.firstHalf: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and consider my supplications;
verses.secondHalf: hearken to me, for your truth and righteousness’ sake.

verses.firstHalf: Enter not into judgment with your servant,
verses.secondHalf: for in your sight shall no one living be justified.

verses.firstHalf: For the enemy has persecuted my soul; he has smitten my life down to the ground;
verses.secondHalf: he has laid me in the darkness, like those who have been long dead.

verses.firstHalf: Therefore my spirit faints within me,
verses.secondHalf: and my heart within me is desolate.

verses.firstHalf: Yet I remember the time past; I muse upon all your works;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, I meditate on the works of your hands.

verses.firstHalf: I stretch forth my hands to you;
verses.secondHalf: my soul gasps for you as a thirsty land.

verses.firstHalf: Hear me, O LORD, and very soon, for my spirit grows faint;
verses.secondHalf: hide not your face from me, lest I be like those who go down into the pit.

verses.firstHalf: O let me hear your loving-kindness in the morning, for in you have I put my trust;
verses.secondHalf: show me the way that I should walk in, for I lift up my soul unto you.

verses.firstHalf: Deliver me, O LORD, from my enemies,
verses.secondHalf: for I flee unto you to hide me.

verses.firstHalf: Teach me to do the thing that pleases you, for you are my God;
verses.secondHalf: let your loving Spirit lead me forth into the land of righteousness.

verses.firstHalf: Revive me, O LORD, for your Name’s sake;
verses.secondHalf: and for your righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.

verses.firstHalf: Of your goodness slay my enemies,
verses.secondHalf: and destroy all those who afflict my soul, for I am your servant.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed be the LORD my strength,
verses.secondHalf: who teaches my hands to war and my fingers to fight,

verses.firstHalf: My hope and my fortress, my stronghold and deliverer, my defender in whom I trust,
verses.secondHalf: who subdues the peoples under me.

verses.firstHalf: O LORD, what is man, that you have shown such respect to him,
verses.secondHalf: or the son of man, that you so regard him?

verses.firstHalf: Man is like a thing of nought;
verses.secondHalf: his time passes away like a shadow.

verses.firstHalf: Bow your heavens, O LORD, and come down;
verses.secondHalf: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

verses.firstHalf: Cast forth your lightning and scatter them;
verses.secondHalf: shoot out your arrows and consume them.

verses.firstHalf: Send down your hand from above;
verses.secondHalf: deliver me, and take me out of the great waters, from the hand of strangers,

verses.firstHalf: Whose mouth talks of vain things,
verses.secondHalf: and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

verses.firstHalf: I will sing a new song unto you, O God,
verses.secondHalf: and sing praises unto you upon a ten-stringed lute.

verses.firstHalf: You have given victory to kings,
verses.secondHalf: and have delivered David your servant from the peril of the sword.

verses.firstHalf: Save me, and deliver me from the hand of strangers,
verses.secondHalf: whose mouth talks of vain things, and whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood;

verses.firstHalf: That our sons may grow up as young plants,
verses.secondHalf: and that our daughters may be as the polished corners of the temple,

verses.firstHalf: That our storehouses may be full and plenteous with all manner of grain,
verses.secondHalf: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our fields,

verses.firstHalf: That our oxen may be strong to labor, that there be no decay,
verses.secondHalf: no leading into captivity, and no outcry in our streets.

verses.firstHalf: Happy are the people of whom this is so;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, blessed are the people who have the LORD for their God.

verses.firstHalf: I will magnify you, O God my King,
verses.secondHalf: and I will praise your Name for ever and ever.

verses.firstHalf: Every day will I give thanks to you,
verses.secondHalf: and praise your Name for ever and ever.

verses.firstHalf: Great is the LORD, and most worthy to be praised;
verses.secondHalf: there is no end of his greatness.

verses.firstHalf: One generation shall praise your works to another,
verses.secondHalf: and shall declare your power.

verses.firstHalf: As for me, I will be talking of the glorious splendor of your majesty,
verses.secondHalf: and of all your wondrous works.

verses.firstHalf: They shall speak of the might of your marvelous acts,
verses.secondHalf: and I also will tell of your greatness.

verses.firstHalf: The remembrance of your abundant goodness shall they proclaim,
verses.secondHalf: and they shall sing of your righteousness.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is gracious and merciful,
verses.secondHalf: long-suffering, and of great kindness.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is loving to everyone,
verses.secondHalf: and his mercy is over all his works.

verses.firstHalf: All your works praise you, O LORD,
verses.secondHalf: and your faithful servants give thanks to you.

verses.firstHalf: They speak of the glory of your kingdom
verses.secondHalf: and talk of your power,

verses.firstHalf: That your power may be known to the children of men,
verses.secondHalf: even the glorious splendor of your kingdom.

verses.firstHalf: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
verses.secondHalf: and your dominion endures throughout all ages.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD upholds all those who fall
verses.secondHalf: and lifts up all those who are bowed down.

verses.firstHalf: The eyes of all wait upon you, O Lord,
verses.secondHalf: and you give them their food in due season.

verses.firstHalf: You open wide your hand,
verses.secondHalf: and fill all things living with plenteousness.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is righteous in all his ways
verses.secondHalf: and merciful in all his works.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD is near to all those who call upon him,
verses.secondHalf: to all who call upon him faithfully.

verses.firstHalf: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him;
verses.secondHalf: he also will hear their cry and will help them.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD preserves all those who love him,
verses.secondHalf: but he will destroy all the ungodly.

verses.firstHalf: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD;
verses.secondHalf: and let all flesh give thanks unto his holy Name for ever and ever.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O my soul;
verses.secondHalf: while I live I will praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Indeed, as long as I have my being,
verses.secondHalf: I will sing praises unto my God.

verses.firstHalf: Put not your trust in princes, nor in any child of man,
verses.secondHalf: for there is no help in them.

verses.firstHalf: For when one breathes his last, he shall return again to the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and in that day all his thoughts perish.

verses.firstHalf: Blessed is the one who has the God of Jacob for his help
verses.secondHalf: and whose hope is in the LORD his God,

verses.firstHalf: Who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is therein;
verses.secondHalf: who keeps his promise for ever;

verses.firstHalf: Who does right to those who suffer wrong;
verses.secondHalf: and who feeds the hungry.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD sets prisoners free;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD gives sight to the blind.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD helps those who have fallen;
verses.secondHalf: the LORD loves the righteous.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD cares for the strangers in the land; he defends the fatherless and widow;
verses.secondHalf: but the way of the ungodly he makes crooked.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD shall be King for evermore,
verses.secondHalf: even your God, O Zion, throughout all generations. Praise the LORD.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, for it is a good thing to sing praises unto our God;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, a joyful and pleasant thing it is to be thankful.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD builds up Jerusalem,
verses.secondHalf: and gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

verses.firstHalf: He heals those who are broken in heart,
verses.secondHalf: and binds up their wounds.

verses.firstHalf: He counts the number of the stars,
verses.secondHalf: and calls them all by their names.

verses.firstHalf: Great is our Lord, and great is his power;
verses.secondHalf: indeed, his wisdom is infinite.

verses.firstHalf: The LORD lifts up the meek,
verses.secondHalf: and brings the ungodly down to the ground.

verses.firstHalf: O sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving;
verses.secondHalf: sing praises with the harp unto our God,

verses.firstHalf: Who covers the heavens with clouds, and prepares rain for the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and makes the grass to grow upon the mountains, and plants for the use of men,

verses.firstHalf: Who gives food to the cattle
verses.secondHalf: and feeds the young ravens that call upon him.

verses.firstHalf: He has no pleasure in the strength of a horse;
verses.secondHalf: neither does he delight in any man’s strength.

verses.firstHalf: But the LORD’s delight is in those who fear him
verses.secondHalf: and put their trust in his mercy.

verses.firstHalf: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem;
verses.secondHalf: praise your God, O Zion.

verses.firstHalf: For he has made strong the bars of your gates
verses.secondHalf: and has blessed your children within you.

verses.firstHalf: He makes peace in your borders
verses.secondHalf: and fills you with the finest of wheat.

verses.firstHalf: He sends forth his commandment upon the earth,
verses.secondHalf: and his word runs very swiftly.
